job title: Junior Interior QS (Salary & Benefits: Insurance + Lunch)
position: Junior Interior QS (Salary & Benefits: Insurance + Lunch)
Job Description:
Responsibilities:

The Junior Interior Quantity Surveyor is responsible for assisting in budget calculations, learning how to manage project deadlines, learning the governing rules and regulations, and performing proper client and employee relations actions.
•Forecast the price/cost of the different materials needed for the project
•Prepare tender documents, contracts, budgets, bills of quantities and other documentation
•Track changes to the design and/or construction work and adjusting budget projections accordingly
•Measure and value the work done on site
•Liaise with the client and other construction professionals, such as site managers, project managers and site engineers
•Select and/or source construction materials
•Review and checking the BOQ at the starting of the work.
•Prepare lists of the site needs (material, workers, technicians)
•Prepare the detailed reports describing the situation of the items quantities, (plus or minus the contract BOQ)
•Support the Senior Quantity Surveyor and team in the commercial aspects of the business.
•Provide assistance managing projects according to contractual obligations.
•Prepare and resolve monthly applications, invoices, and payments according to deadlines.
Job Requirement:
•Bachelor degree in Architecture, Interior Designer or structural engineering related field.
•1- years of work experience related field or fresh graduate
•Practical experience with CAD software, sketch up or others programs related field.
•Knowledge of engineering and construction
•Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
•Willingness to work overtime when required



*Full-time:	08:00-17:00	
*Working time:	Monday – Saturday (Half Day)

* How to apply: 
Interested applicants should submit CV with recent photo, portfolio and cover letter, stating the position applied to chantrea@tdb-projects.com 
Only shortlist candidates will be contacted for interview.

Job Description:

principles and esthetic design concepts.

QuarkXPress.

- Well organized when working under pressure.
- Able to demonstrate problem solving with high quality independent.
- Change management skills, excellent team player, Training and Coaching skills.
- Excellent at Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook email).

Job Description:
• To check stock movement and review stock by SKU (avoid out of stock/stock slow/over stock).
• To inform sales team/marketing team, if stock slow and over stock.
• Review OOS, request to principle additional PO. 
• If over stock in DOH, we will request principle delay shipment. 
• S&OP meeting with sales/marketing, discuss plan for next 2-month and review stock slow/NPD/Over DOH.
• Prepare demand plan rolling order to principle base on S&OP plan.
• Posting PQ and add PO in System, when we received document invoice from principle.
• Follow up with principle and transport about stock in transit; after ETD from factory until ETA Phnom Penh.
• Follow up and double check with Warehouse with Good Receipt PO and close packing list of each Invoice.
• Double check document invoice with actual goods received from transporter 
• If have NPD from Principle, create new product by register form to post new item in SAP system.
• Review in system, whether team WH post goods receipt of shipment with accuracy or not (PO Vs AP Vs Remain balance).
• Update shipment of Pending PO in system and follow up with principle. 
• Update Weekly/Monthly stock compared with sales plan commitment /analysis stock flow and send to all operation team.
• Warehouse visit (goods on pallet/SKU by standard, cleaning, temperature, damage stock).
• Inventory Management (FIFO and ordering system)
• Update DOH Inventory by Monthly.
• Count stock by monthly (Stock self-life, Stock Damage in warehouse, Stock Premium, Stock good).
• Report stock DC and slow item, request Finance clearing stock.
• Summary Invoice (Qty/Amt/Truck) by Monthly.
• Summary shipment packing list/in transit with transport.
• Summary Primary sales Vs Target Principle by month/year.
• Check Email and Coordinate with principle.
• To work closely and weekly record the stock In-Out for Material plan out in every month.
• To checked stock damage from transport and evaluate cut stock from transport.
• To checked and Acknowledge summary stock damage in WH and transport.
• Request promotion from finance clearing stock damage and DC.
• Other tasks assigned by superior
Job Requirement:
Education:
• Bachelor Degree of Accounting
• English

Experience:
• 2 year

Technical skills:
• Word ,Excel, Advance Excel
• Communication, Superior math skill, analytical mind
• QuickBooks, Peach Tree, and SAP system

Others Skill:
• Access to multiple and complex tasks to be performed at the same time.
• Ability to work without command.
• High honesty, accountability, willingness to work, discipline, ability and teamwork.
• There is mutual appreciation.

Job Description:
Trade Programs
• Plan and prepare trade promotion and communication sales kit 
• Support sales team with marketing activities to drive sales volume and distribution, and set guidelines for displays and merchandizing.

Job Description:
PURPOSE OF THE POSITION
- The key role of an Admin to is to assist the NSM in the daily sales operations and administrative tasks of compiling reports, Invoices and Sub Distributor’s Ordering and Claims liaising with internal departments and other administrative tasks. This is to free up NSM executive time so that they can spend maximum time on strategic tasks and decision making. You must possess excellent administrative skills, communication skills to work across many departments.

Targets and KPIs:
- Time Management:  Ensure timely submission of monthly reports and targets
- Quality of Work:  Ensure accurate submission of monthly reports and targets, claims, etc. 

Key Responsibilities / Challenges
- Process and follow-up PO and payment from ASM and Sales distributors
- Process monthly claim promotion from Sub Distributor 
- Setting up, announce and follow-up monthly promotion with Sales Admin in provinces after approval from Trade Marketing.
- Follow-up with Sales Admin (Provinces) on key-in invoices on time or not.
- Relaying instructions or follow up to sales team or other relevant department on important tasks and deadlines
- Filing documents, compiling reports as well as entering data and submit documents to relevant department example Display Outlet & Photos.
- High degree of multi-tasking and time management capability
- Possess integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality  
- Verify and solve problems with Sales Admin in provinces make any error of key promotion
- Timely submission of monthly reports and targets for approval
- Miscellaneous tasks to support their manager
Job Requirement:
Education / Qualifications
- Preferably University bachelor degree in business management or administration		
- Converse well in both written and verbal Khmer 						
- Ability to converse in both verbal and written English is an advantage					

Work Experience / Knowledge
- Minimum 1 year working experience in any discipline preferable Sales & Marketing	
- Proficient in computer skills especially Microsoft Office, Outlook, Google Calendars etc.
- Exceptional filing, recordkeeping, and organizational skills.
- High degree of multi-tasking and time management capability
- Possess integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality  

Technical Skills
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Possess knowledge on filing, administrative and time management skills 				
- Possess excellent inter-personal skills	 dealing with people 
- Ability to work independently with minimum supervision

Job Description:
1 - Liaise with users and other departments to design, develop, maintain and implement computer applications.
2- Liaise with external and internal auditors on computer system audits.
3- Liaise with local or oversea vendors to support them from the beginning phase of SDLC till project go live (e.g. design/implementation/development/integration/testing/deployment and maintenance)
4- Review existing methods, identify problems and evaluate alternative ways of solving the problems.
5- Construct information flow charts and design forms for purposes of recommending organizational and procedure improvement when necessary.
6- For in-house applications, prepare, code, test, debug, modify and document computer programs.
7- To ensure, user manual for all systems are in place in case the applications are out source to vendor. Technical document from vendor should be demanded as stated in SOW for future reference and enhancement.
8- Provide application support for SIT/UAT/production systems to users, testers and developers(vendor in case of out sourcing).
9- Produce and update understandable application system architecture diagrams documents (e.g. servers connections, data flow between servers, communication ports opened etc.).
10- Ensure that work assigned is properly carried out in accordance with established guidelines, procedures and instructions as well as instructed by the Line Manager or Top management.
Job Requirement:
Degree in IT or related fields 
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in application development in insurance or banking & financial industry
- Knowledge in either mainframe, AS400, COBOL, Control Language and SQL Development
- Prior experience in LIFE/Asia (former Life/400) development is an added advantage 
- Strong analytical ability and excellent communication skill
Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

Job Description:
•	Enforce rules for behavior and procedures for maintaining order among the students
•	Conducts assigned classes at the times scheduled
•	Assesses the progress and placement of each student in the program
•	Creates an environment for learning through functional and attractive displays, interest centers and exhibits of student's work
•	Participates in and contributes to the teaching profession;
•	Sponsor extracurricular activities such as clubs, student organizations, and academic contests
•	Select, store, order, issue, and inventory classroom equipment, materials, and supplies
•	Enforces regulations concerning student conduct and discipline
•	Prepare students for later grades or levels by encouraging them to explore learning opportunities and to persevere with challenging tasks
•	Assign and grade class work and homework
•	Establish clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects, and communicate those objectives to students
•	Instruct students individually and in groups, using various teaching methods such as lectures, discussions, and demonstrations.
•	Prepare materials and classrooms for class activities.
•	Observe and evaluate students' performance, behavior, social development, and physical health
•	Perform other tasks assigned by upper manager

•	Associate degree / undergraduate in related field
•	Six months to one year work-related experience in teaching
•	Computer literacy: Ms Word, Ms Excel a plus.
•	Good communication, interpersonal, and customer-service skill.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services

Job Description:
* Senior Accountant Job Description
We are looking for a detail-oriented s
enior accountant to perform and coordinate accounting duties within our organization. The senior accountant's responsibilities include preparing financial reports, performing account reconciliations, maintaining the general ledger, preparing tax returns, assisting with audit preparations, and performing other accounting duties as assigned.
To be successful as a senior accountant, you should have a solid working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and strong financial analysis skills. An outstanding senior accountant should also possess strong Excel skills, be detail-oriented, highly organized, and able to work with little to no supervision and perform under pressure.

* Responsibilities:

• Coordinating accounting functions and programs.
• Preparing financial analyses and reports.
• Preparing revenue projections and forecasting expenditure.
• Assisting with preparing and monitoring budgets.
• Maintaining and reconciling balance sheet and general ledger accounts.
• Assisting with annual audit preparations.
• Investigating and resolving audit findings, account discrepancies, and issues of non-compliance.
• Preparing federal, state, local, and special tax returns.
• Contributing to the development of new or amended accounting systems, programs, and procedures.
• Performing other accounting duties and supporting junior staff as required or assigned.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance required.
• 3+ years of accounting experience.
• Working knowledge of tax laws and GAAP.
• Strong financial analysis skills.
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
• Strong organizational and stress management skills.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly with Excel.
• Ability to train and manage staff.
• Ability to work with little to no supervision.
• High level of efficiency and accuracy.
• Willingness to comply with all local, state, federal, and company regulations.
• Attention to detail and the ability to analyze large amounts of data.

* GBS offer a competitive benefit such as
• Salary and annual salary adjustment
• Health and accident insurance
• Annual trip and party 
• Extra incentive and allowance  
• Work time 44h /1w (8am -5pm)
• Holiday and Public Holiday  
• Annual Leave, sick leave, maternity leave, etc…
• Staff Birthday
• Other benefits

Company Profile:
GBS is a one-stop company for coffee and tea solutions, which is reflected in our logo. Founded in 2016, GBS mission was to foster Cambodian coffee industry through the 3 pillars – product, service and knowledge.
At GBS, we always look out to bring top quality products from around the world to combine with our best-in-class after-sales service. We are currently representing more than 20 brands in Cambodian market including, Nuova Simonelli, Victoria Arduino, Caffé Barbera, Lavazza, Hario, Iberital, Eureka, ODK, Blendtec, Hoshizaki, Melitta, Proaster, D&B, Monbana, Acaia, 3M Water Filtration, and others.
Acknowledging the complication of establishing or expanding a coffee business, thanks to a wide range of product offer, GBS focuses on providing a solution-based product package according to the customers’ individual request and business demand.
We offer complementary training as our barista demonstrates their skill and know-how to assist customer for the challenges in the coffee business environment. We also offer advanced barista and latte art classes for those who would like to further develop their skills.
We take pride in our technical service, as we receive many positive feedbacks since our day one in business. We invest significantly in spare parts to ensure our customer’s machine downtime is limited to the minimum. To compliment this, we ensure that our technicians are well-trained with technical knowledge and are always ready to respond to request for maintenance and repairs.
In 2018, GBS established B-Hub Barista Training Center to offer high quality barista training with tools and resources that allow student to dive deeper into a coffee world. In 2019, GBS began moving toward commercial and specialty coffee roasting, adding three more coffee blends into our product portfolio, as well as customizing special blends to meet the demand. In May 2020, we welcome our new showroom in Siem Reap, which is 40% bigger in space with a dedicated training room.
With all
Contact Info: Contact Information HR HR Manager 069 900 550  career@gbscambodia.com #103E0, St.273,Sk Toul Sangke, Kh Russey Keo. Phnom Penh   069 900 550

Job Description:
* Graphic Designer Job Description 
We are seeking a new Graphic Designer to join our team. You will be designing a wide variety of things across digital and offline media. To be successful in this position, you’ll be a self-starter, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail.

Graphic Designer Responsibilities:

• Planning concepts by studying relevant information and materials.
• Illustrating concepts by designing examples of art arrangement, size, type size and style and submitting them for approval.
• Preparing finished art by operating necessary equipment and software.
• Coordinating with outside agencies, art services, web designer, marketing, printers, and colleagues as necessary.
• Contributing to team efforts by accomplishing tasks as needed.
• Communicating with clients about layout and design.
• Creating a wide range of graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company logos, and websites with software such as Photoshop.
• Reviewing final layouts and suggesting improvements when necessary.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or related field.
• Experience as a graphic designer or in related field.
• Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio.
• Proficiency with required desktop publishing tools, including Photoshop, In Design Quark, and Illustrator.
• A strong eye for visual composition.
• Effective time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
• Able to give and receive constructive criticism.
• Understanding of marketing, production, website design, corporate identity, product packaging, advertisements, and multimedia design.
• Experience with computer-aided design

Job Description:
* Inventory Control

Inventory Manager Job Description 
We are looking for dedicated and reliable Inventory Control to join our growing company. Your chief goal in this position will be to monitor and report on our company’s inventory levels. You will be responsible for developing inventory tracking systems, reviewing levels of supplies, ordering new materials, and performing a daily analysis.
Successful inventory management is a trustworthy professional with outstanding record-keeping and analytical abilities. The chosen candidate will demonstrate excellent organizational and problem-solving skills and the ability to interpret and analyze large amounts of data.

* Responsibilities:

• Design and implement an inventory tracking system to optimize inventory control procedures.
• Sourcing and engaging reliable suppliers and vendors.
• Negotiating with suppliers and vendors to secure advantageous terms.
• Examine the levels of supplies and raw material to determine shortages.
• Forecast inventory, organizing purchase orders, and confirming delivery of goods and services.
• Performing risk assessments on potential contracts and agreements.
• Document daily deliveries and shipments to update inventory.
• Prepare detailed reports on inventory operations, stock levels, and adjustments.
• Perform daily analysis to predict potential inventory problems.
• Order new supplies to avoid inefficiencies or excessive surplus.
• Analyze different suppliers to obtain the best cost-effective deals.
• Preparing procurement reports.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or relevant field.
• A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role.
• Solid knowledge of data analysis, inventory management software, and forecasting techniques.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Access).
• In-depth knowledge of preparing and reviewing contracts, invoicing, and negotiation terms.
• An analytical mind with strong attention to detail.
• Management and leadership skills.
• Outstanding organizational and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and leadership abilities.

Job Description:
Job Purpose: 
The role holder will be responsible for leading a team of analysts and accountants to serve the financial needs of the business and to prepare timely, accurate and relevant reports on financial and strategic performance with insight and recommendations to deliver financial performance.

Main Duties:
Finance/Accounting Operations
	Smooth execution of operational processes, such as processing of payments, tracking of inflows, assets and liabilities, tax management with appropriate controls and in compliance to accounting standards. 
	Write and update financial policies and procedures and ensure documentation is maintained to demonstrate application of controls
	Digitise, transform and improve turn-around time and for services provided 
Reporting
	Provide accurate, relevant and timely reports to all stakeholders to support decision-making and optimize financial and strategic performance.
	Ensure regulatory reports are compiled with accuracy and submitted within timelines
Financial planning and expense management
	Coordinate with all departments to compile the strategy and feed these into budgets and financial projections
	Coordinate with all departments to review business cases for material spends as required by local policy 
	Monitor expenses and underlying spend behaviors and collaborate with all departments to ensure these are in line with local policies.
People management
	Develop competence, capabilities, and professionalism of the team to deliver Financial services to all stakeholders
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

job title: Branch Manager ប្រធានសាខាខេត្តកំពត
position: Branch Manager ប្រធានសាខាខេត្តកំពត
Job Description:
Sales Development & Management: 
-Assist the respective regional head/and CAO of Life Channel to develop and support the branch expansion strategies and plan 
-Liaison with various stakeholders to ensure the timely and successful branch set up   
-Develop the sound branch sale growth strategies and tactical business plan (including recruitment plan) for ensuring the success of the branch sale target under the direct support from the respective Regional Manager and Head of Agency Sales Management. 
-Lead and manage the branch sales and support team to ensure the well execution of the branch sales activity and recruitment plan 
-Closely work with  Pru venture Development Manager (PDM), Business Development Manager (BDM), and agency leader (BM/BD) to ensure better alignment of the branch business plan and sound sale growth activities including recruitment plan 
-Regularly review the branch sale performance and work with the branch team as well as guidance from the regional manager to take prompt and corrective actions for boosting the performance back 
-Conduct the regular branch area market and competition analysis for supporting the branch strategic sales and business growth plan 
-Identify and support key agency leaders to step out into new more potential business territories 

Branch Operation Management: 
-Work closely with cross-functions (i.e. training and development, customer services, sale support operation, NBUW, and property team) to ensure having enough functional support for smoothing the branch business operation with customer centricity 
-Ensure the branch operational efficiency regarding to branch allocated budget, sales materials, branch properties and branch management team productivity 
-As a company ambassador to liaise with local authorities and other business partners for smoothing the branch business and operational activities 
Training and Supervision: 
-Coach and develop the PVM, BDM, and branch support Operation Manager (OM) to make sure they are well equipped with proper skills, right attitude and behavior for delivering their tasks and duties 

Risk and Compliance Management: 
-Manage and control all risk and compliance related to sales and act as first line of defense at the direct team level.  
-Work closely with legal, risk and compliance team at HQ for necessary support and fulfillment.
Job Requirement:
-3-year experience in Financial Services Frontline, Training and development, OR Sales.  
-At least 1 year experience in leading a good team 
-Bachelor’s degree in education/training or business 
-Highly ambitious, independent thinker, disciplinary and high level of empathy 
-Being good at listening skills, teamwork and demonstrates intellectual curiosity. 
-Good problem solving, critical thinking, and motivation/energetic skill 
-Good knowledge of preparing and monitoring the business plan

“ Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC provides equal opportunities to all candidates regardless gender, religious, race, age, social origin based on their merit and non-discriminated qualifications. We believe in diversity in our employee population and make sure the employees have proper guidelines for selection and recruitment process. “

Company Profile:
The Essilor Group has put its expertise at the service of good vision in designing, manufacturing and distributing quality products and services through innovative business models. Today we provide solutions to correct and protect the visual health of the 7.4 billion people in the world.

To achieve this ambition, we place our mission of improving lives by improving sight at the heart of everything we do, respecting the values and principles that have shaped the Group for near 170 years. Our mission unites our 67,000 employees across the world, drives our strategy, stimulates innovation and guides

our commitments to each of our stakeholders. Essilor group has a wide variety of job areas and functions: sales, marketing, R&D, engineering, operations, production or instruments and equipment as well as finance, HR, information systems… With a fast-growing global presence in its historical lenses activity, but also in new markets with their own specific business roles – sunwear, reading glasses, photochromic lenses and online sales – the company offers a multitude of career paths, often international, that will develop your skills and grow you permanently.

To support our growth, we’re recruiting new team members with a variety of skills and complementary talents… Why not you?

Read more on https://www.essilor.com/

Job Description:
- Manage daily stock refill for retail shop and ensure the physical inventory and stock management system are maintained accurately at the beginning of every business day
- Do monthly and annual stock planning and initiate the strategies to ensure to maintain stock levels for supporting the sale demand;
- Manage and develop stock policy with clear process and ensures the stocks are manage effectively;
- Ensure the implementation of stock policy is accurate and followed by all team members
- Ensure the risks are minimized and avoided frauds such as cheating
- Engage and lead stock team by monitoring and checking /following up the team’s work to ensure effectiveness and efficiency of the operation department
- Manage and maintain stock systems to ensure the stocks are well organized and sufficient stock for daily business operation at retail business partner;
- Review the bar code system of each product and check the number of actual products and quality of products, ensure the products are kept in warehouse properly
- Provide training or coaching session to stock team and relevant sales staff at each shop regarding excesses and shortages of products
- Review and check the inflow product and outflow product report based on the actual flow of products
- Submit monthly stock report to the Operation Manager and propose the recommendations if needed
- Verify stock in and Stock out report submit by stock keeper, and take action in case stock error between in system and stock report on hand.
- Finding stock error or mistakes occur by take in & take out and provide and recommend stock problem solving.
- Alert to Operation for any risks that will be happened to the company and propose the best solution for taking appropriate actions
- Other job assign by Operation Manger
Job Requirement:
1- BA in Business Administration or other related field
2- At least 4 years experiences in inventory Management,
3- Competence in Computer skill (Ms. Word and Excel) and stock management system
4- Demonstrate the ability to communicate and negotiate
5- Demonstrate the ability to do the analysis and forecasting about the products movement.
6- Analytical skill
7- Attention to detail
8- Effort and reliability
9- Problem solving skill
10- Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
11- Possess mathematical skill

- Working Day: Mon-Sat, Day off: Sun
- Working Hour: 08 hours per day.
- Gross Salary: 600-700

** Other Benefit:
- A/L: 18 Days, SL: 6 Days, Reserve Leave: 7 days
- Vacation 1 Week-2 Weeks
- Annual Bonus & Gift
- Training & Development
- Insurance 24 hours
- Annual Party
- Annual Increment
- Other benefit

Job Description:
JOB RESPONSIBILITY:

– Manage Production, Sales, and Inventory volumes (PSI management).
– Checking that inventory levels are appropriate and communicating with dealers and buyers to make adjustments.
– Build a good relationship with the electronics store representative and obtain sales information from the store.
– Together with the Account Coordinator, provide product explanations and training to staff.
– Analyze the consumer electronics market and the competitive situation to derive issues and countermeasures.
– Frameworks such as 4P, 3C, and PEST will also be used.
– Formulate strategies based on market analysis and create sales and profit plans.
– Create product presentation materials in PowerPoint.
– Analyze the PL (Profit & Loss)of products to identify issues and guide improvement measures.
– Other duties assigned by Manager.
Job Requirement:
JOB REQUIREMENTS: 
– Have a bachelor’s degree.
– English proficiency for daily business conversation.
– PC skills (PowerPoint and Excel).
– Strategic and logical thinking.
– Strong communication skills.
– Work experience as a Sales or/and Marketing.
– Good with numbers.

PRIORITY
– Manage experience inventory.
– Experience in the same industry or/and in the same position.
– Interest in consumer electronics and Japanese companies

BENEFIT
– NSSF
– Accident insurance
– Bonus (minimum 1 month)
– Transportation and accommodation fee

job title: គ្រូមធ្យមសិក្សា រូបវិទ្យា គីមីវិទ្យា
position: គ្រូមធ្យមសិក្សា រូបវិទ្យា គីមីវិទ្យា
Job Description:
•	បង្រៀន និងធានាឲ្យបាននូវគុណភាពនៃការអប់រំ ទាំងចំណេះដឹង បំណិន និងអភិវឌ្ឍបុគ្គលិកលក្ខណៈ
•	បំពេញកិច្ចការដ្ឋបាលសាលា និងរដ្ឋបាលថ្នាក់រៀន
•	ពង្រឹងវិន័យសិស្សឲ្យបានខ្ជាប់ខ្ជួន។
•	ណែនាំ និងសម្របសម្រួលសកម្មភាពរបស់សិស្ស
•	ពិនិត្យតាមដាន និងធ្វើរង្វាយតម្លៃជាប្រចាំដល់សិស្ស
•	សាកសួរដល់ផ្ទះសិស្ស និងជំនួបរវាងមាតាបិតា ឬអ្នកអាណាព្យាបាលសិស្ស
•	ជួយសិស្សក្នុងការស្រាវជ្រាវឯកសារក្នុងបណ្ណាល័យ និងអភិវឌ្ឍបំណិនជីវិត
•	រក្សាឲ្យបាននូវបរិស្ថានថ្នាក់រៀនប្រកបដោយសុវត្ថិភាព និងមិនប៉ះពាល់ដល់សុខភាព
•	សម្ភារបរិក្ខារ និងសម្ភារឧបទេស ដែលបានបំពាក់ក្នុងថ្នាក់ ត្រូវធានាឲ្យបាននូវការថែរក្សា ប្រកបដោយការយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ និងត្រឹមត្រូវ
•	ប្រើប្រាស់ទីធ្លាលេងកម្សាន្ត ដែលជាផ្នែកមួយនៃសកម្មភាពសិក្សាក្រៅថ្នាក់ ដើម្បីធានាថាទីធ្លាលេងកម្សាន្តនោះប្រកបដោយសុវត្ថិភាព
•	បំពេញកិច្ចការផ្សេងៗចាត់តាំងដោយប្រធាន
Job Requirement:
និសិ្សត ឬមានសញ្ញាបត្រមធ្យមសិក្សាគរុកោសល្យផ្នែកមធ្យមសិក្សា
•	បទពិសោធន៍បង្រៀនចំណេះទូទៅខេមរភាសា កម្រិតមធ្យមសិក្សា
•	យល់ដឹងអំពីច្បាប់អប់រំប្រទេសកម្ពុជា
•	យល់ដឹងអំពីក្រមសីលធម៌វិជ្ជាជីវគ្រូបង្រៀន និងច្បាប់ស្តីពីការអប់រំ
•	ចេះកសាងសម្ភារឧបទេស និងតុបតែងថ្នាក់រៀន
•	អាចប្រើប្រាស់ភាសាអង់គ្លេសសម្រាប់ទាក់ទងប្រចាំថ្ងៃបាន កាន់តែប្រសើរ
•	អាចប្រើប្រាស់កុំព្យូទ័រ Ms. Word & Excel
•	មានសមត្ថភាពធ្វើការដោយឯករាជ្យ និងជាក្រុម
របៀបដាក់ពាក្យ
ប្រាក់បៀវត្សប្រកួតប្រជែង សូមដាក់ប្រាក់បៀវត្សរំពឹងទុក! បេក្ខជន បេក្ខនារីដែលមានចំណាប់អារម្មណ៍ ត្រូវបានអញ្ជើញមកដាក់ពាក្យស្នើសុំការងារ ឬផ្ញើអ៊ីម៉ែលមកកាន់ recruit@arizonschool.edu.kh លេខទូរស័ព្ទ 015 678 109 ឬ 081 900 812។ អាស័យដ្ឋានៈ អាគារលេខ ១៧៣ ប៊ីស ផ្លូវលេខ ១៨២(ឧកញ៉ាទេពផន) សង្កាត់ផ្សារដេប៉ូទី១ ខណ្ឌទួលគោករាជធានីភ្នំពេញ។

Job Description:
-	Coordinates and plans the administrative functions of each project.
-	Prepares, maintains and reviews records and reports for accuracy and completeness.

-	Evaluates existing and proposed administrative or operational policies, practices and techniques and recommends improvements.
-	Assigns work, provides direction to clerical staff and ensures that assigned tasks are completed. 
-	Ensures effective and appropriate clerical staff coverage. 
-	Provides feedback on their performance and conducts performance evaluation.

-	Collects, researches, organizes and summarizes data from a variety of sources and produces reports such as program status and board reports.
-	 Maintains client and program information using spreadsheet and/or database software.

-	Performs other related duties as required.

-	Bachelor degree in Business Administration, or related field.

-	Excellent in English, Chinese and Khmer.

-	Computer skills, including Ms. Word, Outlook and Excel.
-	Good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills.
-	Good command in both spoken and written English.

Company Profile:
At DKSH, our purpose is to enrich people’s lives by providing access to goods, services and insights. United by our vision to be the trusted partner, we help companies grow in Asia and beyond across our Business Units Healthcare, Consumer Goods, Performance Materials and Technology.

Delivering life-saving drugs to hospitals, bringing high-quality products to remote villages, installing technology that raises living standards and providing new formulations for healthcare products that make life easier. These are just a few examples of how DKSH touches people’s lives around the clock. We do this while helping our clients and customers grow by providing services including sourcing, market insights, marketing and sales, eCommerce, distribution and logistics as well as after-sales services.

Listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange, DKSH operates in 36 markets with 32,450 specialists, generating net sales of CHF 10.7 billion in 2020. Founded by Swiss entrepreneurs in 1865, we have been deeply root

Job Description:
1. Job Description
Under the direction of the Factory Manager, you will organize, coordinate and optimize the production of the factory from paddy input to finished products. You will participate in the industrial strategy and production objectives. Having an energy efficiency mindset, you will ensure optimal production. Organized and meticulous, you will assist in budget planning & controlling in compliance with quality objectives, costs, deadlines and regulations. You will foster a culture of continuous improvement and a lean management approach.

** Your main duties:
- Improve the production quality to obtain quality label for the factory (HACCP, IFS…).
- Supervise, organize and coordinate production activities.
- Able to solve complex technical problems using your creativity when necessary.
- Streamline the manufacturing processes and procedures to maximize the required quality.
- Evaluate the team’s skills and setup a training & development plan to increase their potential.
- Participate in a logic of continuous improvement and lean management approach for the production department (equipment, methods, human resources).
- Assist in all aspects of technical incident and/or near miss investigations by completing root cause analysis and implementing preventive actions across the production line.
- Follow and enforce the health and safety plan in your department.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s degree and/or five (5) years of related production/rice mill factory experience
- Extensive knowledge of production best practice guidelines and requirements
- Experience in working environment following ISO, HACCP, GMP or IFS Quality Management Standards
- Lead by example to enforce a culture of excellence and production compliance
- Excellent written & oral communication skills required
- Detail oriented with solid problem-solving skills
- Good command of MS Office (Word, Excel & Outlook)
- Function in a team environment with employees in all levels of the organization
- Provide superior customer service and support company goals
- Valid driver’s license and ability to travel

- Salary: US$700-US$800 upon skills and competence
- Location: Battambang, Cambodia
- Please send CV and letter to: contact@fedrice.com
Company Profile: Since 2013, the Duval Group has specialized in food products. The Group imports Asian products into the French ethnic market and has positioned itself as one of the main players in its sector. Duval Group owns a rice factory in Cambodia and export to different markets its rice, including jasmine long grain rice harvested and processed in Cambodia (named best rice producer country in 2018). The group is also in the business of organic and fair-trade rice.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   contact@fedrice.com #310KM, Vealtrea Village, Otaki Commune, Battambang Province

Job Description:
1. Job Description
The Sales & Marketing Officer works closely with the General Manager and the Chief Operating Officer based in Bangkok to develop target income goals. Goal-oriented and driven, the Sales & Marketing Officer must create a sales plan that meets specific benchmarks and offers room for growth. He/she acts as a liaison between customer and factory. Using his/her extensive customer network, the Sales & Marketing Officer will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every customer in order to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels and profitability.

** Your main missions are:
- Present, promote and sell rice using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
- Develop the company's activity internationally, including being active on social media (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn…)
- Find new target markets and penetrates them to drive sales
- Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
- Manage the sales network, track sales and status report
- Plan advertising and promotional campaigns for products or services on a variety of media (social, print etc.)
- Conduct market research to identify opportunities for promotion and growth
- Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to ensure a high level of client satisfactions.
- Maintain healthy receivables & monitor level of bad debts
- Work Closely with other departments of the company
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor Degree in Sales & Marketing Management field or related.
- Proven work experience as a Sales & Marketing Officer (at least 3 years)
- Familiarity with BRM and CRM practices along with ability to build productive business professional relationships
- Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
- Excellent selling, communication and negotiation skills
- Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
- Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
- Good understanding of market research techniques, statistical and data analysis methods
- Thorough understanding of social media and web analytics
- Relationship management skills and openness to feedback
- Fluency in English and Khmer is required
- Professionalism, honesty, integrity and teamwork


- Salary: 600 to 900 $
- Please send CV and letter to: contact@fedrice.com

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Job Description:
+ Internal/External Interactions:

    - Report to the Ford General Manager
    - Work with Sales team

    - Work with Aftersales team

    - Work with the RMA Group

      office as necessary

    - Customers
    - Authorities 
+ Functional Responsibilities 
 - Ensure a high level of internal and external of standard 
   from the company perspective.
 - Supervise staff engaged in inspection and testing 
   activities to ensure high productivity and high technical 
   integrity.
 - Develop and analyze statistical data and product 
   specifications to determine standards and to establish 
   quality and reliability expectancy.
 - Provide technical and statistical expertise to teams.
 - Formulate, document and maintain quality control 
   standards and on-going quality control objectives.
 - Coordinate objectives with production procedures in 
   cooperation with other manager and minimize costs.
 - Create, document and implement inspection criteria and 
   procedures.
 - Interpret quality control philosophy to key personnel 
   within company.
 - Provide, and oversee, inspection activity for physical 
   item to be checked throughout the QC cycle.
 - Apply total quality management tools and approaches to 
   analytical and reporting processes.
 - Provide report to GM for the QC report from the 
   inspection for improvement 
 - Maintain active role on internal continuous improvement 
   teams.
 - Design, develop and implement quality control training 
   programs.
 - Regular Planning for QC and Come up with strategy to find 
   the way improve the Operations managers

+ Travel Requirements: 
  -Mainly within Phnom Penh and Provinces.
Job Requirement:
• Management, Business Administration, Finance and Accounting, 
  Quality Control and Related skills
• At least 5 years prior experience working as QC function 
• Demonstrable track record of developing and training staff.
• A rational person 
• Good at Reporting with proven 
• A strong command of English (Writing, Reading and Speaking)
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Job Description:
Study & Identify the manufacturing process needs for new components or new products
Design systems, processes, facilities & methods to ensure the cost-effective assembly operations
Assist with shop floor layout and cell designs
Design fixtures and tooling for assembly processes
Generate production documentation such as assembly instructions
Reduce variability in manufacturing by providing standard work methods and work instructions
Support the tender process for equipment to ensure the best quality for best price
Improve manufacturing efficiency by analyzing and planning workflow, space requirements and equipment layout
Prepare FMEAs, (Failure Mode Effects Analysis) process documentation and implement improvements
Investigate production and process issues providing technical support and training
Coordinate with Overseas mother plant for ECN, tooling changes, resolving process issues etc.
Perform root cause analysis and resolve problems
Produce written reports and make presentations
Job Requirement:
Around 5 years of experience in automotive assembly plant (high volume preferred)
Good understanding of engineering drawings, Auto-Cad
Comprehensive knowledge of automotive assembly line planning, standards, QMS, layout, tooling and processes
Good communication skills in English
Expat is encouraged to apply

job title: Factory Engineering and Maintenance Engineer (PEM Engineer)
position: Factory Engineering and Maintenance Engineer (PEM Engineer)
Job Description:
• Lead facilities improvement projects; prepare SOWs for new equipment and machines, maintenance scheduling, asset upkeep and safety/regulatory compliance, coordination of plant facility and equipment related work with vendors/contractors. 
• Preventive and Breakdown maintenance of plant machines and equipment
• Work with Outsource Contractor and labor for maintenance work.
• Construct the proposed whole year preventive maintenance plan to all PD, QC & WH and significant facility tools and equipment. Ensure preventive maintenance plan is fully effective and consider to update/ change the plan if the plan does not recover/ meet the performance. 
• Capability to set up the maintenance room with 5S, safe work place and easily accessible system. Implementing the documented tool recording system for input/ output the tools to concern department.  
• Must be able to provide the training of tool and equipment handling/ using technique and knowledge to protect from potential damaging.
• Controlling factory and building security system and consider the plan to do yearly trial. Able to communicate with government fire department for additional fire security system.
• Troubleshoot mechanical and electrical problems. Supervising at install, repair and maintain piping systems. Experience with large air compressors, building automation systems and fire alarm systems is essential.
• Recording and analyzing the generator fuel usage and brainstorming to reduce the cost and improving the environmental aspect.
• Ability to supervise and differentiate the work significant sectors and performing the job assignment with timetable/ deadline. Practicing the PDCA to meet the deadline and report to superior.
• Good communicate the outsource supplier and overwhelming skills to deal them in order to follow the deadline.
• Lead facilities improvement projects, consisting of scope definition, resource planning, scheduling, implementation, and acceptance, to include coordination of work with vendors/contractors. 
• Use problem-solving tools to identify root cause for repetitive breakdowns or other losses. Address key issues and educate peers of problems and solutions. 
• Requires the ability to use personal computers for document editing, report generation, controller programming, database backups and restorations. Should have good skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and MS Outlook.     
• The main task of this position to ensure accurate inventory management and efficiently serve the material to production lines
• Machine breakdown & maintenance cost control
• Ensure machine uptime to avoid production loss
Job Requirement:
• Educational certification from a recognized technical institute, preferred.
• Engineering or equivalent in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering
• Analytical Thinking, Innovative or Creative Thinking, Flexibility, and Service Orientation
• knowledge of Assembly line machines & Equipment, Leadership skill, Problem Solving skills, and Service Mindset
• Minimum of 5+ years of maintenance & facility function.  
• Requires the ability to read equipment manuals, HVAC, electrical and plumbing schematics in order to install, maintain and repair electrical and mechanical devices.
• Ability to troubleshoot and resolve equipment malfunctions on chillers, pumps, valves, dehumidifiers, air compressors, VAV boxes, and many other types of devices.  
• Should be proficient in wielding, soldering and brazing.
• Ability to understand interaction of equipment systems and diagnose and repair mechanical, pneumatic and hydraulic problems.  
• Ability to understand interaction of equipment and systems, and diagnose and repair electrical problems.
• Must be knowledgeable of water treatment technologies.  
• Interpret data, identify problems, and formulate proper decisions.
• Express ideas clearly (verbal and written) and ability to work from verbal and written instructions, manuals, wiring diagrams, work orders and specification.
• Ability to generate and analyze reports charts and KPI's dealing with addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of whole numbers, fractions, and decimals.
• Demonstrated knowledge in the use, maintenance and care of tools, equipment and machinery.
• Demonstrated experience of very strong mechanical ability is required.
• Demonstrated experience of working independently is required.
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Company Profile:
HMC Broiler is our supply chain which is created to add value to the slaughtered-aged broilers from HMC farm*. The main business activities are slaughtering activity and supplying channels to the supermarket markets and retail stores.
Product portfolios, from slaughter house of HMC Broiler, guaranteed quality and safety to the consumers. Items ranging from whole bird to cut-up meats, wing, drumstick, half-chicken, chicken feet, etc., aiming to meet daily market demand. Products will be stored in a preserved environment such as cold showcases and cold rooms to maintain stable quality and increase consumers’ awareness on food safety for themselves as well as their loved ones. 
By collecting output from HMC Farm with cost efficient and healthy broilers, HMC supply channel will be able to sell their products with affordable price to our potential clients at various markets. 
Through client-first approach, HMC broiler will have networks of supply chain throughout the country aiming to make sure our product portfolio is nearby and within reach by clients to experience its high-quality products—which affordable price and hygiene is our non-negotiable unique proposition to our customers.

job title: Executive Assistant (Good command of Chinese and English is a plus)
position: Executive Assistant (Good command of Chinese and English is a plus)
Job Description:
This position is responsible for mainly providing professional administrative and secretarial support for the company’s daily business operations for General Manager to ensure the smooth management of day to day affairs. 

- Provide professional interpretation / translation services for General Manager and or/ other individuals for meetings, interviews, telephone calls, documents etc., including one to one and group settings. 
- Manage General Manager’s electronic diary, assessing priority of appointments and reallocation as necessary.
- Manage General Manager’s travel arrangements (including visas/accommodation).
- Assist General Manager in researching and following up with action on matters which fall within the General Manager’s responsibility – chasing responses, triggering follow-up action.
- Review translated material for accuracy of meaning, grammar and syntax
- Assists with Administration tasks related to interpretation or translation assignments as requested
- Manage and maintain the management’s diary and email account as much as possible
- Ensure busy diary commitments, papers and travel arrangements are managed effectively including producing a daily folder with diary, necessary papers etc. and troubleshooting problems
- Coordinate travel and accommodation requirements in connection with others and ensure arrangements in place for the management match his/her requirements
- Filter general information, queries, phone calls and invitations to the management by redirecting or taking forward such contact as appropriate
- Keep and maintain an accurate record of papers and electronic correspondence on behalf of the management
- Minute general meetings as required and complete research on behalf of the management
- Provide and ensure guests meeting with the management are well taken care of
- Other tasks assigned by management
Job Requirement:
- A minimum of Bachelor Degree in related field
- Good command of Chinese and/or English is a plus
- A minimum of 3 years translation/secretarial experience with private company
- Shorthand and excellent typing skills, speed and accuracy essential
- Good computer literacy (MS Office, Excel, PowerPoint)
- Excellent organizational skills & excellent communication skills, both verbal and written 
- High sense of job responsibilities
- Proven ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines 
- Bright, confident personality, well presented 
- Flexible and mature approach with ability to work unsupervised 
- Willing to travel

Company Profile:
OYIKA is a Singapore venture-funded company which started working on a battery share concept for e-motorbikes in 2018. In 2019, OYIKA arrived in Cambodia and launched a service in the capital of Phnom Penh. The company is headed by its President, Carl Wong, and it plans to expand throughout the Kingdom and in SEA.

OYIKA offers a battery share concept and allows an e-motorbike rider to swap their leased depleted battery for a fully charged one at a swap station. So instead of topping up petrol at a kiosk when the vehicle runs out of fuel, the rider is now topping up on stored power. Battery share, therefore, replaces petrol and thus it is also cheaper.
OYIKA claims its battery share solution solves the issues of driver anxiety, battery degradation and upfront capital costs which also act as barriers to the adoption of electric vehicles.

Company Profile:
From a very humble beginning as a small roofing sheet roll former in 1997, ISI STEEL, A member of ISI GROUP, has successfully transformed itself from a family-run business into a midsize corporation leading Cambodia's steel processing industry. With modern processing facilities, world-class management systems and technology, dedicated staff and nationwide distribution networks serving our customers nationwide, ISI STEEL has become a truly reliable and respectable local brand synonymous with quality roofing and wall cladding systems and structural steel products.

This would not have been possible without the strong support of our customers, local and international business partners, our staff's dedication and hard work, and last but not least the government efforts for maintaining the political stability and sustainable economic growth. To ensure our company’s sustainable development and industry-leading position, we are committed to further invest in upgrading our manufacturing facilities, expanding our distribution network, building up our human capital, technology infrastructure, and product innovations to better meet our customer's need and expectation.

While continuing to strengthen our core capabilities in the manufacturing and distribution of quality coated steel products, we have over the years ventured into a number of related diversifications such as pre-engineering steel building fabrication, property development including industrial park, residential, offices and resorts developments, and other construction materials trading business through our subsidiary and affiliated companies to capture the opportunities in the growing economy of Cambodia.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description:
Responsible for accurate receiving, storing and preparing and shipping orders of product Knows their responsibility in a contingency plan or crisis situation. Must be able to work the shift pattern as required by company. 

Responsibilities: 
• Oversee all cargoes receiving at Air Cargo Terminal, our CFS or Factory’s premise follow individual customer SOP.
• Ensure cargoes are properly checked and accurately count quantity.
• Ensure cargoes are received in good condition.
• Ensure cargoes are weighted and taken dimension correctly.
• Ensure all re-taped carton, damage or torn on cargo delivery form
• Ensure cargos are secured during the vendors’ broker perform customs formality and send to bounded warehouse
• Record all inspected cartons on on-hand sheet 
• Record all re-taped carton, damage or ton in proper approved form and inform to CS
• Complete on-hand sheet form and issue to shipper or shipper’s appointed broker timely and scan them into edoc on next working day
• Coordinate with Service Provider to completed cargo delivery form and release to shipper or shipper’s appointed broker timely.
• Co-ordinate with air operations to provide the accurate cargo dimension and gross weight immediately upon receiving cargo from shipper
• Perform cargo scanning as needed for any particular customer such as C/GAP, NIKE or others
• Understand the loading requirement for the particular customer and explain to warehouse staff for compliance 
• Monitor warehouse staff in checking empty container which must be meet 7 points checklist of Container Security Checklist Inspection Form before loading any freight in.
• Monitor the loading cargo into the containers and take pictures
• Follow up with Service Provider for container arrival timely.
• Perform any other assignments as deem necessary.
• Communicate politely and firmly with all customers, co-workers with provision of exceptional customer service in mind
Job Requirement:
• High School certification or having degree in Business Administration or related degree.
• Entry level experience.
• Well versed in public speaking.
• Good in English language
• Positive attitude, team player and hard working.
• Ms Office: Word, Excel, etc.

* Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time

Further information about the Company can be obtained at Expeditors’ website: http://www.expeditors.com. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Job Description:
1 . Brief Description (3-4 lines)

This position is responsible in providing suite of services and products to external customers. The primary responsibility of this position is to work with internal & external customers in taking booking, service enquiries, quotation, problem solving and handling customer calls.
Ensure that all processes are performed as per APL/APLL and customer’s standard requirement.


2. Key Result Areas (2 – 3 Key Items)
What does the job need to deliver? How is it measurable?
• Customer received data info/shipping advice on time and accurate.
• Customer received Invoices both local and over sea on time and accurate.
• Customer/Customs broker received document on time and accurate.
• Shipper understands all customer requirements and provided all information/document timely.
• Shipper received release container, FCR/BL on time.


3. Key Accountabilities/Duties (6 –7 items)

• Ensure understand customer requirements, SOP compliance for those customers
• That was assigned to take care.
• Deliver 100% data Integrity i.e. accurate booking, clear information to customers.
• Provide customer with timely, accurate and courteous service. Maintain a professional and pleasant demeanour and communication.
• To assist customers when problems arise by liaison with the relevant internal parties – Ops/Finance.
• Pro-actively advise customer on exceptional service notification. 
• Prepare customer’s customisation reports (According to SOP)
• Problem Solving
• Measure KPI
• Coordinate bookings between factory & carrier & customers.
• Continuously improve the existing process in order to meet and exceed customer need.
• Ensure follow updated SOP & UI
• Support Customer Services Supervisor on all group activities.
• Maximize productivity.
• Flexible mindset able to take cares complex customer (more process/requirement in SOP)
• Lead CS role, to assist the supervisors as a trainer for the CS team.
• Handle all CS related matters as assigned by GD, CSM, CS Supervisor.
Job Requirement:

• Strong communication skills & customer service orient
• Fluent in spoken and written English plus ability to converse in Mandarin

Talent Management•Act as business partner and provide HR advice to managers and employees.•Coordinate employee engagement activities.•Conduct regular meetings with managers on employees’ performance and people issues.•Support HR Manager in annual performance management exercise.Talent Development•Support HR Manager in training needs analysis, training program design and post-training evaluation.•Source external vendors for training programs.•Coordinate with external vendors, internal trainers and employees in the delivery of training program.Others•Support HR Manager in the roll out of corporate and regional HR initiatives.•Ensure all HR tasks are complied with internal policies and local regulations.•Support HR Manager in HR reports, statistics and analysis.•Maintain up-to-date employee records in P-file and HR systems.•Support local office admin tasks.•Ad hoc tasks assigned by HR Manager.

Job Description:
** Job Purpose* 
This position is responsible for: 
• Delivering APLL commitment to key customers, meeting day to day operations requirements of the customers. 
• Managing a team of logistics coordinators to achieve operations excellence through defined and agreed processes.
• Supporting the local engineering and sales development team in the sales process, and engineer opportunities into customized supply chain solutions

** Roles & Responsibilities* 
1. Operations:
• Supervise, monitor and guide logistics Coordinators to comply with customers’ and vendors’ requirements.
• Execute established processes and audit measures to support and meet customers’ requirements at agreed level. 
• Keep continuous improvement (CI) and modernizing the facilities.
• 5S and SSE implementation including regular training and audit.  
• Liaise with other functional/departmental managers so as to understand all necessary aspects and needs of operational development, and to ensure they are fully informed of customer services objectives, purposes and achievements.
• Oversee and maintain operations reports and inventories records, prepare reports and analysis to forecast space and resources requirements to cope with changing volume trends.
• Periodic review of costs and revenue, conduct benchmarking exercises and ensure APLL continues to be competitive in the market place.
• Streamline processes to achieve cost savings and ensure profitability
• Deploy resources amongst inter/ intra department to ensure sufficient resources are allocated to manage changes in volumes and increasing demands of customers.
•	Manage service providers to ensure compliance to customers’ requirements.
•	Ability to communicate/work/negotiate with service providers especially 2PL.
•	Facility analysist, facility risk management and backup plan solution.
•	Continuously identify and train a team of Logistics Coordinators to meet the demands of customers in a professional manner.
•	Conduct periodic reviews and training to service providers especially 2PL team, warehouse tallyman and labours.
•	Manage trucking activities for inbound shipment, factory to CFS and outbound shipment, CFS to CY including customs formality and clearance.

2. Business Solutions:
• Support business development teams in the sales process to win business for the organization and to meet revenue and margin objectives.
• Analyse the effectiveness of client’s operations, develop optimal and well-conceptualized logistics solutions, and work with country sales team to develop detailed proposals including solution design, cost models, process flow simulation, and other logistics factors within customer defined timelines.
• Work closely with Country Customer Service Lead and Sales team to develop pricing solutions and perform profit and loss analysis for customer business opportunities.
• Manage and develop suppliers for sourcing and procurement of contract logistics that includes customs and transportation services.
Job Requirement:
• Good communication & presentation skills in Cambodian and English 
• Analytical skills
• Project management skills
• Ability to effectively & efficiently adopt/adapt information technology and logistics solutions as an enabler to supply-chain processes.
• Pro-activeness, self-motivated, eager to learn.

** Key Result Areas 
• Monitor and ensure that tariffs are updated, available for commercial and tender purpose.
• Run successfully product development to support commercial development.
• Meet and exceed timeliness of submission of proposals and solutions.
• Meet and exceed presentation and layout expectations of submitted proposals and presentations.
• Ensure customers’ requirements are understood and complied by service providers, customer service representatives and vendors
Company Profile:
APL Logistics provides global, integrated supply chain services in more than
60 countries, including both origin and destination services such as freight
consolidation, warehousing, and distribution management. APL Logistics
offers consulting solutions and uses IT for maximum supply chain visibility and
control. APL Logistics is a member of the Kintetsu World Express (KWE)
group, a global logistics services provider.

Job Description:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Check all the documents for application and credit information collected by 
Credit Officer before or after field check
- Complete application information in e-finance system (Financial Product tab, 
Asset tab, and Document tab)
- Check performance for application in e-finance system 
- Check and correct mistake for application on e-finance system
- Check customer’s liabilities, repayment, repayment history and recent inquiries 
for other financial institutions through Credit Bureau of Cambodia
- Make a decision on application by examining all documents for application and 
CBC report in accordance with underwriting policy
- Inform the request for field check to POS if needed
- Call chief of village or commune or related party to verify the lessee’s identity, 
current address, occupation and other information
- Call Human Resource (HR) staff of lessee’s company to verify employment of 
lessee, salary, position and period of employment
- Call to interview applicant and guarantor to assess on identity, current address 
and income
- Calculate application’s income, expense, liability and repayment capacity
- Provide an exact information concerning application to Senior Underwriter or 
Supervisor with all documents for application as needed.
- Submit application to MGT to request approval via e-finance system
- Complete the Reject Form and submit to Rejected Committee to request for 
rejection on application via UW server and then upload Rejected Form that 
approved by Rejected Committee to e-finance after that click on Rejected 
button to reject application
- Inform the result of Rejected Committee validation (rejected) to Applicant.
- Report status of operation and its problem to Senior Underwriter and get the 
instruction
- Report number of application per day to UW admin every working day
- Do cooperate with another department to make process smoothly
- Other duties are assigned from Management if it is necessary and urgent
Job Requirement:
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
- At least Bachelor Degree in Finance, Banking, or other related fields.
- Understanding in Micro-Finance, Banking, Credit.
- Good commend in English language (Speaking, Writing and Listening).
- Be honest, team work, and good communication skill.
- Computer knowledge (Ms. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Internet & 
Email
