Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description:
Responsibilities: 
•	Design the UI/UX for a broad range of digital marketing deliverable: landing pages, web sites/applications, mobile apps, and more and test them amongst focus groups.
•	Document design before handover to development teams for implementation. Initiate and obtain creative feedback from managers at appropriate junctures. 
•	Integrate user research in the design process; illustrate a command of design methods, tools, communication, and presentation skills. 
•	Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverable to various stakeholders.
•	Create, lead and develop all stages of the User Experience and User Interface works including case scenarios, user flows, process flows, wireframes, interaction models, story boards, site maps and assets preparation.
•	Maintain highest level of innovative design execution. Accountable for leading and/or supporting the conceptual, strategic and design development of multiple small and large scale projects and maintain deliverable schedules for timely completion of projects. 
•	Work as a primary point of contact with cross-functional teams throughout the design and development process, including product development committee, marketing, and other business units or third parties to successfully go from early stage product concepts to launch.
Job Requirement:
Requirements:
•	Bachelor/ Master’s degree in Information Technology, Design, and other related degrees
•	At least 3 years of professional experience as an UI/UX Designer or Interaction Designer 
•	Experience in designing visual and interactive interfaces for web, mobile web sites & applications as well as mobile and emerging device software as a UX visual designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role.
•	Experience with one or more UX design, wire-framing and prototyping tools, such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, InDesign), Axure, OmniGraffle and Balsamiq, or other visual design / wire-framing tools.
•	Analytical, communication, negotiation & problem-solving skill
•	Be proactive and good team work and customer service orientation skill
•	English language proficiency and Chinese speaking is added advantage

Company Profile:
CAMHR is Cambodia’s leading human resources and recruitment company, specializing in providing human capital resources and assets. Launched in 2009 by CAMHR INFORMATION (CAMBODIA) CO. LTD, we have grown from specializing in online recruitment to offline, sourcing employees of all standards for businesses and organizations across the country.

Job Description:
- Gather and analyze data/information from different sources for preliminary audit assessment under the guidance of senior auditor/supervisor to identify potential risks to the audit mission by macro process at provincial level.

- Conduct audit testing on operational and financial transactions in branch offices and interview clients to evaluate the design and implementation of internal controls by entities.

- Collect sufficient and appropriate audit evidence on specific macro processes under the supervision of the senior operational auditor or supervisor to rate the quality of internal controls for those macro processes.

- Follow up, during the audit mission, previous audit recommendations by entities (provincial offices, branches and mini-branches) to assess whether auditees have actioned recommendations and to classify the status of each recommendation.

- Consolidate the findings of assigned auditing tasks, including root causes and recommendations, in a working paper and submit to the senior operational auditor or supervisor to ensure the complete and accurate recording of identified breakdowns in internal controls.
Job Requirement:
- Degree in Business Administration or related fields.

- Minimum 1 year experience in auditing or related field.

- Experience in auditing, accounting, internal control and compliance checking.

- Willing to travel to other provinces.

- Good computer literacy.

- Good verbal and written communication in both English and Khmer.

Job Description:
** Hotel Receptionist Job Description:
Greeting and ensuring that guests are accommodated are the primary roles of a hotel receptionist, often referred to as a hotel front desk agent or clerk. The hotel receptionist is typically the first hotel employee guests encounter when they arrive at a hotel, so easy conversationalists with a welcoming, courteous manner will help set the right tone in this role. They’re also tasked with managing reservations and checking out guests. Receptionists work for both large hotel chains or smaller, private facilities. Because hotels serve guests at all hours, receptionists may need to work weekend and holiday shifts during any range of the establishment’s operating hours. Often an entry level position, hotel receptionists report to the front office or hotel manager. Experience as a receptionist can kick start a career in a variety of roles within the hospitality industry.

** Hotel Receptionist Duties and Responsibilities:
* Check-in Guests
Hotel receptionists greet incoming guests and welcome them to the hotel. They confirm reservations, explain hotel amenities, give directions to rooms, and produce room keys. They also arrange for luggage to be brought to rooms upon request.

* Handle Guest Inquiries and Complaints
From providing additional linens to handling complaints about noise or room temperature, hotel receptionists are responsible for accommodating guests during their shifts. They contact necessary personnel, such as managers or housekeeping, to handle specific requests or complaints.

* Answer Phones
Hotel receptionists take all incoming calls at a hotel. They handle phone reservations, confirm previously-made reservations, give directions to the hotel and answer any questions customers have about the lodgings.

* Process Payments
When a guest’s stay is over, hotel receptionists handle check-outs. At this time, they will issue payments such as additional room charges and process debit or credit cards to pay for room fees.
Job Requirement:
** Hotel Receptionist Skills:
- Strong interpersonal, verbal communication, and customer service skills are the top abilities needed for hotel receptionists. They should be patient and display above-average organizational skills. The abilities to deal effectively with crises and work with a diverse population are essential for this position. The following skills are commonly sought after by employers:

- Administration – while some on-the-job training will be provided, receptionists need a level of comfort in computer, bookkeeping, phone, and other administrative skills.

- Math skills – calculating guest charges and settling room payments as well as processing invoices and completing payment transactions require basic math skills from receptionists.

- Attention to detail – in order to maintain a functioning front desk, receptions are highly organized and detail-oriented.

- Multitasking – hotel receptionists often juggle many requests at a time and are good at prioritizing tasks without missing a beat.

- Customer service – as the first in line to respond to guest complaints and special requests, hotel receptionists excel at dealing with people in a professional, calm manner. They are natural listeners who understand the importance of verbal and non-verbal communication.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr Chamroeun  015 515 565 info@pacifichotel.asia 234, Monivong Blvd, Sangkat Phsar Thmei II,Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 015 515 565

Company Profile:
We do this by delivering innovative packaging that offers significant value for brand owners, retailers and consumers alike. This is no small achievement, since value means something different to each of these stakeholders.

Crown’s creative packaging solutions are well-suited to address each of these interpretations of “value” thanks to the inherent properties of metal and the innovation that has taken place throughout our company’s history.

We are proud to be the leader in metal packaging technology. With operations in 47 countries employing over 33,000 people and net sales of $11.6 billion, we are uniquely positioned to bring best practices in quality and manufacturing to growing economies in Asia, Eastern Europe, South America and the Middle East and North Africa. Whether improving existing technology or pioneering a new concept, we are committed to working in partnership with our customers to drive their businesses locally and globally.

So whether you are getting to know Crown for the first time, or are a long-time friend, this site will provide the resources you need to increase turnover at the retail shelf, add differentiation and build consumer loyalty - in short, to use innovative packaging as a powerful means to build stronger brands.

Job Description: Objective: The position is required to perform the critical Data Governance role for AIA Cambodia. The role is set up in alignment with the requirements from Group’s Data Governance StandardsJob Responsibilities:• Drive initiatives in defining, documenting and maintaining data management policies, standards and procedures in alignment to the AIA Data Governance Standards.• Drive the development, documentation, and updating of technology and business processes pertaining to data governance across business functions.• Work in collaboration with Local Data Council, Business Divisions and IT to enforce data management policies for addition, removal, modification, and use of company data.• Perform the main coordinating and communication function of the local data council. • Identify sensitive personal or proprietary data (PII / PSI etc) that requires protection and establish and execute appropriate policies• Understand and map out flow of data internally & externally• Establish and maintain a data dictionary• Help build processes to maintain clean and consistent data across the organization• Collaborate with the Software Development teams to identify potential issues related to data usage during development efforts.• Participate and represent Data Management team in the Local Data Council to discuss and act on data usage, consistency, and issues.• Collaborate with Compliance team on capturing and implementing regulatory requirements for relevant to data management• Prepare Data Profiling / Data Quality report to monitor data quality KPIs for Local Data Council• Lead the follow-up actions related to data challenges and remediation resulted in the Local Data Council meetings•  Ability to maintain, execute and constantly improve the data governance standard of AIA Cambodia•  Ability to deliver to data quality goals defined in Local Data Council•  Effectiveness in stakeholder management•  Effectiveness in team management
Job Requirement: Education• Bachelor / Master’s degree level education from a recognized University preferably in Information Technology, Business Administration and/or Insurance Studies etc• Certified Professional level certification in Data Architecture, Data Analysis etc is a definite advantage.Work Experience• Minimum of three (02) years of work experience having demonstrated the application of Data Governance / Management experience in a similar functional role and in an enterprise level working environment.• Having lead and provided policies, industry best practices guidance and supervision relating the Data Governance to relevant teams from Business and Technology.• Having managed cross functional multiple projects in parallel at project portfolio basis.• Ability to work cross border and multinational working groups.• Experienced in executing regulatory requirements for data privacy protection from PDPA, GDPR or any other international standard acts is an advantage.Knowledge and Skills• Excellent skills in Business user engagement and stakeholder management• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.• Domain proficiency in insurance business and its operations including distribution channels would be an advantage.• Experienced in Informatica or any ETL and DQ tools would be added advantage.• Able to work independently and highly self-motivated.• Able to work with peers and other stakeholders, a team player.
Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

Job Description:
Job Summary:

1. To manage the business analysis related functions within IT which acts as an intermediary function between the Business Users and the IT solution providers.
2. To provide research, analytics and business justification to support solution evaluation and decision-making process for solution approval.
3. To manage the solution providers and solution delivery as per agreed expectations.
4. Manage the UAT process towards timely implementation and systems go-live

Key Responsibilities:

1. Drive the stakeholders for completion of documentation relating to business requirement capturing and system designing specifications with required verifications and sign-off. (URSs and SFSs)
2. Provide necessary support and guidance to the Users as well as Solution Providers to transform User Requirements to Systems Functional Specs.
3. Evaluate best suitable solutions for AIA with business justifications and recommendations for management approval.
4. Manage solution providers through the RFP, Procurement and sourcing, legal and technology risks related documentation and timely payments to ensure successful closure of the projects (solution delivery and implementation)
5. Manage the UAT process and solution implementations with timely go-live
6. Work with Business Users to ensure preparation and validations of UAT plans including the Test Scripts as per the signed off URSs/ SFSs.
7. Maintain close working relationship with the Business Functional Users as well as the Solution Providers to ensure smooth execution of projects until its successful closure
8. Ensure carrying out people development and motivation activities sufficiently to ensure availability of right competencies for solution delivery as expected by the senior management.
9. Perform other responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by the reporting authority in order to achieve the overall functional objectives of the division.
Job Requirement:
Job Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree level education in business, IT or similar field.
• Professional training, diploma or certification in Business Analysis or similar field of expertise
• At least 5 years of work experience in similar functional environment with responsibilities
• Evaluation of IT solutions involved close interaction with business Users and Solution providers including ability to prepare documentation for evaluation and recommendation for management approval 
• Have a good understanding and working experience in the IT field of financial service industry. Experience in Life Insurance is an added advantage
• Good knowledge of Business Analysis in a financial service field
• Good knowledge and practice in Software Development Lifecycle
• Good communications skills, both spoken and written in English and Khmer.
• Should be IT Savvy with proficiency in word processing, spreadsheets and presentations
• Good listening, negotiation and interpersonal skills
• Possess personal traits: Initiative; self-driver, team player, detailed and meticulous

* Raw Material & Pkg, Procurement & Planning 
•Material planning process for production. 
•Raising orders or calling off material, review and approve 
•Schedule and advise Warehouse and Stores of pending goods arrival

•Aluminum scrap reconciliation.

•Month end reports on all activities under your responsibilities 
•Supply Chain dimensional leaders activities

Job Description: Objective: To drive the end-to-end delivery of the AIA TDA (Technology, Digital and Analysis) and its related IT project(s) on time, within budget and to support deriving the expected project KPIs. This role is responsible for defining, tracking and communicating in a consistent and effective manner and incorporating effective change, resourcing and risk management controls at project level. Job Responsibility: 1. Manage the assigned IT related project(s) as per AIA Standards and within given budget and timelines, including:• Define project scope, goal, deliverables and identify resource that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.• Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents with identified project dependencies and critical path.• Closely track project milestones and deliverables and document the identified risk and issues until closure.• Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, presentations and its timely reporting.• Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency and mitigation plans.• Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear manner.• Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors, and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.• Manage project budget according to established accounting policies and procedures; forecast project cash flow and report actual cash flow and variance to senior management on a regular basis• Ensure that project activities operate within the policies and procedures of the organization• Conduct project post implementation reviews and submit appropriate recommendations in order to identify project overview, assessment of the predefined KPI achievements and the key lessons learnt. • Keep and archive project documents for audit and future reference purposes.2. Cultivate and support an ethical culture to fulfill legal and compliance requirements and encourage professionalism amongst stakeholders.3. Perform other related project management responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by the reporting line management in order to meet operational and corporate objectives.
Job Requirement: Education• Bachelor / Master’s degree level education from a recognized University preferably in Project Management, Information Technology, Business Administration and/or Insurance Studies etc• Certified Professional level certification similar to Prince2 / PMP is a definite advantage.Work Experience• Minimum of three (03) years of work experience having demonstrated the application of Project Management Principles in an enterprise level working environment.• Having managed cross functional multiple projects in parallel at project portfolio basis.• Ability to work cross border and multinational working groups.• Having exposure to the agile project management fundamentals is an advantage.Knowledge and Skills• Strong interpersonal and leadership skills and ability to motivate and engage team members.• Excellent communication skills at all levels (all levels of project stakeholders).• Excellent time management and tasking skills.• Ability to organize and prioritize multiple tasks to meet deadlines, flexible and adaptable to a dynamic working environment for program delivery.• Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills• Ability to work independently in a structured organizational operating environment• To be able to perform collaboratively as a good team player• Skilled ability to foster continuous improvement and innovation; ability to accept and lead change initiatives throughout the organizationPassion in project/program management with proven track record of result orientation

Job Description: 
• Implement the Business Quality Framework 
• Perform distribution/sales analytics and set up business predictive models 
• Provide periodic update to the Head of Agency Operations and Compliance team on quality of distribution & sales

• Conduct incident-based training in conjunction with Compliance and Agency Training

• Perform other duties as assigned by the management team

• Bachelor’s degree in Business or Law or related field is preferred
• At least 3 years of compliance experience
• At least 2 years of Knowledge in life insurance industry is an advantage
• Proficient communications skills to effectively explain policies with Agency distribution force and internal stakeholders

Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

Job Description:
Reporting to: CEO 
Location: SME Cluster site – Takhmau, Kandal Province 

The Tenant Services - Senior Manager will provide the effective leadership of the Tenant Services team (including specialized service providers) by taking responsibility for the development and delivery of the SME Cluster’s Tenant-facing service offerings and its “Active Management” business model. 
The Tenant Services Unit – Senior Manager will responsible for these key areas: 
• Develop and lead the Tenant Services Business Unit as a WBID Profit Center 
• Manufacturing FDI, SME & Startup company recruitment & assessment (both foreign and local). 
• SME & Startup business & operational readiness using the WBID “ACT5 Tenant On-boarding” Program. 
• Delivery of Tenant Business Services. 

Worldbridge Industrial Developments., Ltd. 38th Floor, The Bridge (Soho Tower) St. 78, Tonle Bassac, Chamkarmorn Phnom Penh, Cambodia 
• Labor Recruitment for Tenants. 
• SME Management and Labor Skills Development 
• Ongoing Tenant capacity development using WBID’s “Active Management” philosophy 
• RGC OWS Center coordination, Ministry relations and readiness for business services delivery. 
• SME Cluster amenities planning & operations 
• SME Cluster communications & scheduling platform development guidance & upkeep 
• SME Cluster information database development and upkeep. 

I. General Management Responsibilities: 
• Assist the CEO and WBID Sales & Marketing Unit in Tenant Recruitment, value chain planning and other activities which support Tenant development and growth. 
• Making presentations and attendance at SME & Startup related events. 
• Lead the development of an effective and services-oriented Tenant Services team. 
• Oversee the financial activities of the Business Unit including developing and management of budgets, resources and activities to ensure Business Unit profitability. 
• Identify and manage vendors needed for delivery of specialized business services. 
• Ensure the activities of the Tenant Services team are transparent, in compliance with all Cambodian laws and regulations and follow international best practices at all times. 
• Reconcile and approve all invoices from Services providers. 
• Maintain the SME Cluster Information database with accurate and up to date materials related to SMEs, Startups or Industrial Development related policies and programs from the public and private sectors. 
• Conduct periodic SME business readiness and sectoral surveys. 
• Lead weekly business unit meetings and participate in regular WBID Management meetings. 
• Perform other Tenant Services related duties as requested by the WBID CEO. 

II. SME & Startup Tenant Development responsibilities 
• Coordinate and lead Tenant recruitment events in Cambodia & overseas 
• Lead the WBID Tenant “ACT5 On-boarding” process from potential tenant assessments to capacity building activities to final handover including support in processing of SME benefits and incentives. 
• Liaise, coordinate and negotiate with RGC Ministries & Departments related to the Cluster and Tenant’s business activities to ensure that all applicable Incentives, financing and other benefits are granted. 
• Proactively develop and maintain good Tenant relations at all times. 
• Provide informed advice, mentorship and guidance to Tenants regarding activities or programs which may better the Tenant’s business efficiency or profitability (WBID Active Management philosophy). 
• Inform and or coordinates the with other WBID Business Units to ensure complete service delivery and Tenant Satisfaction. 

III. Business Services delivery: 
• Lead the coordination of Tenant business services delivery including logistics services, labor recruitment, skills training and direct business services. Direct special service requests to the appropriate Business Unit or external service provider. 
• Provide prompt, accurate and professional processing of documents, applications and other statutory operating requirements on the behalf of the Tenant including the processing of RGC based SME Incentives, financing or loan applications, operating licenses / certificates or applications for specialized FDI or SME development programs. 
• When requested by the Tenant, coordinate the recruitment of skilled staff or production labor. 
• Oversee the preparation of official reports, documents, etc. for the RGC or local authorities related to manufacturing, labor relations and or skills development. 

IV. Skills Development & Training 
• Develop an active program / network for the recruitment of skilled and unskilled labor as a business service. 
• Following the “ACT5 On-Boarding Program”, conduct regular assessments of the Tenant’s further labor, skills and training needs including soft skills, business management and or professional / technical / operational skills. 
• Provide guidance and recommendations to the Tenant regarding skills development and training program which supports the Tenant’s growth and development plan. 
• Assist the CEO in the planning of the WBID Technical Training Center 

V. RGC OWS Center 
• Serve as the primary contact point with designated RGC representatives for SMEs or SME Cluster programs and or business operations requirements. 
• Oversee and coordinate the planning and operations of the SME Cluster’s on-site OWS Center including its facilities, network access and other RGC requirements. 
• Oversee and coordinate the planning and operation of the SME Cluster’s on-site and web-based OWS information center. Train WBID staff to be able to serve visitor related queries. 
• Coordinate and attend meetings between Tenants and RGC officials as required. 
• Develop a digital, on-line Communications and RGC scheduling tool for the SME Cluster website 

VI. SME Cluster Amenity Operations & Communications 
• Oversee the readiness of the SME Cluster Office Building and facilities for visitors, events and services delivery at all times. (The Tenant Services BU may direct other departments to support) 
• Coordinate the planning and operations of Tenant-facing business support amenities. Amenities include, Main Reception & Display areas, Testing Laboratories, Career development / Training Center, OWS Center, Worker Canteen, Vendor Kiosks, Worker Housing, Conference Center, Workshops, 
• Develop a list of public and private events which promote and benefit the SME Cluster, its Tenants and or manufacturing sector development. Support the planning of the events with the Marketing BU. 
• Develop a digital, on-line amenity scheduling tool which is to be made available on the SME Cluster website.
Job Requirement:
Candidate Profile 
• Hold a Bachelor’s degree or higher in a business, legal or management related field. 
• Have strong working knowledge, experience and understanding of the local SME & Startup community including RGC policies, programs, challenges and supporting ecosystem. 
• Have strong ability to discuss, influence and or negotiate with local SMEs and startups. 
• At least 6 years’ working experience in a manufacturing-related administrative, legal or business advisory position. 
• Have strong organizational and time management skills. Be able to manage multiple tasks at one time. 
• Have very strong leadership and interpersonal communication skills. 
• Have command of both spoken and written Khmer and English 
• Have good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite. 
• Be attentive, proactive, diligent and able to work in a team setting. 
• Overseas or working experience with multi-national manufacturers or companies is an advantage.

To realize our vision to be number one diverse solution provider launching pioneer projects in Cambodia, human capital is of the essence to the Group and we are now looking for talent to join and grow with us.

Job Description:
Reporting to: Technical Services Sr. Manager / CEO 
Location: SME Cluster site – Takhmau, Kandal Province 

The Facilities Management - Senior Officer will provide the effective leadership of the Facilities Management team (including specialized service providers) by taking responsibility for the development and execution of facilities management planning and procedures, staff management and maintain good Tenant and Vendor relationships. 

The Facilities Management – Senior Officer will responsible for these key areas: 
• Assuring the 24/7 operational readiness, security, safety and full capability of the SME Cluster including its facilities, infrastructure and operating systems for its users, tenants and the public. 
• The cost-effective management and execution of the facilities maintenance programs and procedures. 
• The management of an effective and responsive Facilities Service Window that embraces a “one-stop-service” concept which ensures all customer requests are actioned with a high level of service. 
• Oversee and ensure that all tenant fitouts are compatible and in operational compliance with the SME Cluster’s facilities & infrastructure standards, operating systems and statutory regulations. 

Responsibilities of the Facilities Management – Senior Officer 
I. Management Responsibilities: 
• Assist the design and oversight for the construction of new facilities including infrastructure connections, tenant facilities, fit outs and equipment installations. 
• Develop and implement the SME Cluster Maintenance program including the preparation and execution of regular maintenance schedules, procedures and best practices for all facilities, infrastructure, equipment and operating systems. 
• Prepares yearly facilities maintenance and upgrades budget and tracking. 
• Provide explanations, training and or operating instruction to Tenants at the handover of their premises. 
• Develop and manage vendors for the Tenants Facilities Service Window in a manner which ensures initial responses within 30 minutes and action taken within 18 hours. 
• Ensure SME Cluster’s security and its user and guest safety including traffic safety, environmental protection, fire protection, security and conveying systems. 
• Ensure compliance with the SME Cluster’s Environmental Management Plan (EMP) including its waste water treatment plant and emissions monitoring systems etc. 
• Ensure the activities of security and all services providers are being done in compliance with contract terms and conditions. 
• Ensure that all SME Cluster Facilities as-built documents are up to date and accurate. 
• Reconciles and approves all invoices from facilities related vendor and services providers. 
• Perform other Facilities Management related duties as requested by WBID management. 

II. Facilities Operational responsibilities 
• Ensure the 24/7 readiness and cleanliness of the SMEs Cluster’s public areas, facilities, infrastructure and tenant facilities including all power, water, waste water and drainage systems. 
• Ensure that all public and emergency lighting fixtures and alarm systems are fully maintained, operational, functional and inspected. 
• Ensure that all fixtures and systems in public areas (such as lighting, security, access control etc.) are maintained, fully operational and functional. 
• Ensure SME Cluster backup power systems are maintained, fully operational and functional. 
• Oversee and direct the activities of the SME Cluster’s Security vendor. 
• Oversee and direct the activities of the SME’s Cluster’s Cleaning vendor. 
• Oversee and direct the activities of the SME Cluster’s Gardening vendor. 
• Oversee and direct the activities of domestic and industrial waste collection and disposal vendors 
• Ensures that security personnel are equipped and capable to respond to medical emergencies, fire events, security breaches and or other events which may harm the property or wellbeing of the Cluster’s users, tenants, guests or public. 
• Assist other WBID Departments to prepare facilities for events or activities. 
• Informs and or coordinates the with other WBID departments to ensure tenant satisfaction. 

III. Inspections & Reporting: 
• Performs regular inspections of SME Cluster facilities. Infrastructure and systems. 
• Coordinates regular inspection by local authorities, vendors or service providers. 
• Coordinates regular safety and fire drills with authorities. 
• Perform regular Safety inspections of tenant installations, equipment and systems. 
• Prepares Weekly operational readiness report to Department Sr. Manager and CEO. 
• Supports the Senior Manager in preparing reports, documents, etc. for licenses or certificates required by the local authorities
Job Requirement:
Candidate Profile 
• Hold a degree or certificate in an engineering, construction or property management related field 
• At least 7 years’ working experience in an engineering, construction and or facilities management related position. 
• Have strong organizational and time management skills with an ability to manage multiple tasks at one time. 
• Have strong leadership and interpersonal communication skills. 
• Have command of both spoken and written Khmer and English 
• Have good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and documentation software such as AutoCAD or Revit 
• Be attentive, proactive, diligent, able to work independently and have good interpersonal skills. 
• Working experience with non-traditional infrastructure systems such as solar power, RO waste water treatment and or advanced security systems is an advantage. 
• Overseas or working experience with multi-national manufacturers or companies is an advantage

Job Description:
Personal Assistant to Chairwoman is in charge of supporting daily operation of the Chairwoman. Also, he/she need to control legal affair and financial audit for the company as assigned by the Chairwoman.  

** Duties and Main Responsibilities: 
1.	Manage diaries and directories, and maintain executive’s agenda meetings/ appointments as instructed by and for Chairwoman and other Senior Management
2.	Co-ordinate with all senior management and Board member regarding travel arrangements
3.	Responsible for arranging the events and conferences
4.	Remind Chairwoman of important tasks and deadlines
5.	Review business documents for Chairwoman, which may include Agreements/Contracts, calculating and verifying the numbers, terms and conditions, taxations…etc.
6.	Review the financial statements, revenues and expenses for reporting to Chairwoman, manage cash-related transactions, documents and requests from and by other internal departments, suppliers, vendors, contractors and sub-contractors
7.	Manage database and filing systems with finance of all Agreements/Contracts, meeting memos, notifications, land titles and other Company’s legal documents and certifications
8.	Implement and maintain internal procedures, secretarial and administrative affairs and protocols for Chairwoman, including the Company’s stamp, official letters, announcements…etc.
9.	Support the Chairwoman in her projects, proposals, etc. through research, consultation, team-management
10.	Maintain the complaints file and ensure all complaints are responded to within target timescales
11.	Control access to Chairwoman
12.	Facilitate with another department to collect daily, weekly, and monthly report
13.	Conduct research and prepare presentations or reports as assigned
14.	Handle confidential documents and ensure they remain secure
15.	Performing other tasks assigned by Chairwoman
Job Requirement:
** Reports to be produced
1.	Weekly Report (individual tasks and Department Report) 
2.	Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly Performance Report 

** Job Requirement
1.	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance and Accounting or related field
2.	At least 5 years of experience in secretarial, internal auditing and administrative affairs;
3.	Proficiency in Khmer and English, Chinese is a plus
4.	Strong communications skills
5.	Excellent letter writing and organizational skills
6.	Positive thinking, dynamic teamwork, self-motivation, time management, disciplinary, respectful, helpful, supportive, communicative, cooperative and result-oriented; 
7.	Ability to work under pressure to agreed deadlines and adapt to change
8.	The ability to pay high attention to details
9.	Computer literacy in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint);
10.	Moderate knowledge of protocol procedures, documentation and filing;
Company Profile:
Phnom Penh Land Development was established in 2016 but its long history was stemmed from some real estate business since 2012. The Company has engaged with big projects of apartments and condominiums for most of the international clients. We are now the developer of the smart city ready for stock exchange market of billion-dollar listing in New York. Grown well from the small to the big sizes among other local and international project developer in Cambodia, we are handling construction projects, including steel handicrafts, shops, houses, apartment, condominiums, villas, schools and many others. Our employees are now more than hundreds. Company Profile: Forte Insurance is leading the growth of the insurance industry in developing Southeast Asia. Since its founding in Cambodia in 1998, Forte has remained true to a very clear and simple mission: to provide customers with products and service that meet their needs and help them protect their families and businesses, and to contribute to the development of the overall industry in the markets in which it operates. With a focus on innovation, continual improvement, flexible solutions, and attentive customer service, Forte has become the premier insurance company in Cambodia and Laos, and it is the preferred partner of multinational insurers. Forte is also an employer of choice that offers a collaborative and collegial workplace that rewards achievement and provides staff with numerous opportunities to continue their professional education and development.

Job Description: Job Description•	Responsible for developing a plan to achieve sales target•	Responsible for carrying out prospecting calls plan and meeting plan•	Responsible for establishing and managing relationships with customers in need of the firm’s freight transportation services•	Maintain consistently positive interactions to nurture customer relationships•	Take ownership of customer issues and follow-through till resolution•	Represent the firm in negotiating and building relationship with shippers and carriers•	Responsible for aiding successful pick-up and delivering, and over the road assistance while customers’ freight moves across America’s motorways•	Perform Cold-calling (Follow up call or meeting) and work to build a book of businesses.•	Research potential leads from business directories, web searches, or digital resources•	Receive and report on all sales leads•	Answer potential customer questions and follow-up call questions•	Work with sales team when closing sales•	Track weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance and sales metrics
Job Requirement: Job Requirements•	Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, business, or related field preferred•	Knowledge: good understanding of sales concepts, methods, and techniques, have industry knowledge and 1-2+ years of domestic logistics experience•	Also, having a proven record of sales success and in-depth knowledge of logistics products and services is a plus to an applicant•	Interpersonal skills: Networking and relationship building are vital to getting referrals and successfully closing sales•	Computer skills: Microsoft Office applications•	Communication skill: Communication, whether it is via email, phone, or face-to-face is crucial in making a sale, excellent verbal communication skills to convey information on the company’s solutions to clients and prospects, as well as to provide customer support as needed•	Time management and ability to multitask: must be able to schedule their daily activities, including customer visits in an optimal manner, making phone calls and sending emails or instant messages to co-workers simultaneously•	Negotiation skills: responsible for giving quotes to clients, as well as negotiating with shippers and carriers. Therefore, it is essential that they can influence clients taking a position that confers maximum benefit to the company.•	Can work under pressure with customers complain
Company Profile:
CAMHR is Cambodia’s leading human resources and recruitment company, specializing in providing human capital resources and assets. Launched in 2009 by CAMHR INFORMATION (CAMBODIA) CO. Job Description:
- Knowledgeable and trained in quality system requirements, including internal audits.
- Initiates all internal audits and ensures they are conducted in an efficient and timely manner.
- Delegates responsible, trained staff, if applicable, to carry out specific audits of testing activities.
- Document and tracks staff who have completed auditor training.
- Collect and analyze data to detect deficient controls; duplicated effort, extravagance, fraud, or non-compliance with laws, regulations, and management policies.
- Report to management about asset utilization and audit results, and recommend change in operations and financial activities.
- Prepare detailed reports on audit finding.
- Confer with company officials about financial and regulatory matter.
- Other duties as requested by management.
Job Requirement:
- At lease graduate in Accounting/Finance;
- Preferable with experience in using Sage ERP Accpac 6.0 Accounting System;
- Must have 3-5 years experiences working as SOP Auditor or Senior Auditor;
- Good command of English and computer.
- Male or Female;

* Working day
- Monday-Saturday (Break one hour)
- Lunch time (12am-13pm)

* Salary and Benefit:
- Salary negotiable based on experience
- Uniform
- Lunch
- Insurance covered
- Annual bonus

Job Description:
1. Determine scope of review in conjunction with the Senior 
   internal Audit Manager.
2. Establish risk-based audit programs.
3. Prepare checklist/internal control questionnaires (ICQ) 
   for project and construction management, project costing, 
   and project quality survey.
4. Lead internal auditors for conduct the internal audit 
   assignments in projects based.
5. Control and spot check the QS of project costing, project 
   management and construction management.
6. Conduct risk assessment on functional area based on Audit 
   schedule.
7. Review the adequacy and effectiveness of internal control 
   systems of function audited.
8. Conduct audit testing of specified area and identify 
   reportable issues and dimension of risk know how to 
   communicate at your level during entrance and exit 
   meetings with auditees and communicate within the 
   department effectively.
9. Other duties assigned by Senior Internal Audit Manager.
Job Requirement:
Education/ Experience

1. Bachelor’s degree Accounting or 
   Finance or ACCA preferred, but MBA in accounting or 
   finance from accredited university is a plus.
2. At least 3 years internal auditing, external auditing 
   related to real estate industry.
3. Experience in Quality Surveyor is advantaged.
4. Fluent in Khmer and English. 
5. Can use and understanding about Ms. Office and Auto CAD 
   and other architecture design program is advantage.
6. Attended internal audit training.
7. Can use understanding about project construction 
   management and architecture design.
8. Understanding about Quality Survey and site inspection. 9. Strong analytical written/verbal communication, 
   interpersonal, and relationship building skills.

Job Description:
A. Overall Purpose Of The Job 
Raffles Medical Group are looking for a Chinese speaking doctor to provide Fee For Service consultations at their clinic in Phnom Penh to provide competent, patient-centered care that addresses health needs and promotes wellness. Such care is based on latest evidence and guidelines and meets legislator requirements. Also, to provide peer support to other doctors of the same practice.

B. Key Responsibilities 
- Provide skilled health assessment, diagnosis and treatment services to patients
- Order diagnostic tests as needed, check and follow up the results in a timely manner
- Administer and prescribe treatment and drugs effectively
- Refer patients appropriately, in consultation with Supervisor, to other healthcare providers if their
needs exceed the range of care the Clinic can provide
- Consult, collaborate and work constructively and harmoniously with colleagues to provide optimal care
- Document all care provided and education or information given to patients within their medical health
record, as per professional and practice standards
- Participate in annual performance appraisal and set work and personal goals for the upcoming year
- Maintain a working knowledge of legislation that affects medical practices
- Provide services courteously and respectfully with regard to the cultural beliefs and needs of patients
- Respond openly to complaints or feedback
- Declare vested interests in services that you may be referring to
- Demonstrate a working knowledge of company policy with regard to clinic practices as described in Standard Operating Procedures and Policies
- Report incidents as required
- Protect and maintain the confidentiality of medical information or records of patients
Job Requirement:
* Required Skills and Knowledge
- Medical Skill
- Chinese and English Communication
- Computer: Word, Excel
- Customer centric.
- Customer Service Mindset
- Good Interpersonal Skill

Required Competencies
- Strong interpersonal communication
- Active listening skill
- Ability to use computerized patient management systems
- Ability to keep a cool head in emergency situations
Required Work Experience
- At least 5 year experience as a general practitioner / doctor
- Experience working in a multinational working environment

* Required Qualifications
- Registration or license as a General Practitioner
Required Languages 
- Chinese
- English
Company Profile:
Raffles Medical Cambodia was opened in 1992 and is renowned for the delivery of comprehensive international standards of medical services. The staff consists of well qualified doctors and nurses who are familiar with the health dynamics in Cambodia, and are able to provide full support for expatriates, residents and tourists for day to day health management, vaccinations, medical stabilization and treatment in the event of a medical emergency.

Patients will receive the same high level of service and renowned quality of care, with continued access to our panel of international and local doctors. Patients and onshore panel of doctors can also expect to benefit from access to the clinical expertise and support from the Raffles specialists in Singapore.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR  023 216 911 / 012 497 761 saly_man@rafflesmedical.com No 161, Street 51 Beoung Raing, Duan Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 023 216 911 / 012 497 761

job title: អ្នកថតវីដេអូ និងថតរូប
company_name: ក្រុមហ៊ុន ម៉េងលី ជេ. គួច អេឌ្យូខេសិន (Mengly J. Quach Education)
position: អ្នកថតវីដេអូ និងថតរូប
Job Description:
• គ្រប់គ្រងការចាប់ប្លង់នៃការផលិតវិដេអូ
• បង្កើតនិងកែច្នៃប្លង់ឳ្យកាន់តែមានភាពទាក់ទាញ
• អាចចុះផលិតវីដេអូខ្លីៗដោយខ្លួនឯងបាន
• ថែរក្សាឧបករណ៍របស់ក្រុមហ៊ុនឳ្យបានល្អគ្រប់ពេលវេលា
• មានសម្ថភាពបំផុសគំនិតថ្មីៗដល់ក្រុមការងារ
• គោរពវិន័យរបស់ក្រុមការងារក៏ដូចជាក្រុមហ៊ុនអោយបានល្
Job Requirement:
• ស្គាល់ច្បាស់ពីរបៀបប្រើប្រាស់ កាមេរា
• យល់ដឹងពីការចាប់ប្លង់
• រហ័សរហួនក្នុងការបំពេញការងារ
• អាចចេះកាត់តខ្លះៗកាន់តែប្រសើរ
• មានវិន័យល្អក្នុងអាជីពការងារនិងជីវិត
• មានគំនិតថ្មីៗសម្រាប់ពង្រឹងការងារអោយកាន់តែមានប្រសិទ្ធិភាពនិងភាពទាក់ទាញ
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   012 797 939 hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh Building #223 & 227, Mao Tse Tong Blvd., Sangkat Toul Svay Prey I, Khan Boeng Keng Kang, Phnom Penh 012 797 939

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description: Scope & Role PurposeCivil EngineerCivil engineers create, improve and protect the environment in which we live. They plan, design and oversee construction and maintenance of building structures and infrastructure, such as roads, railways, airports, bridges, dams, irrigation projects, power plants, and water and sewerage systems. They also design and build tall buildings and large structures that can withstand all weather conditions.• Manage and push up progress site works.• Plan the work and efficiently organize the construction schedule in order to meet agreed   deadlines and keep updating it.• Check the construction finishing quality.• Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the site labor   force and the work of any subcontractors.• Check and approve the progress payment with sub contractors.• Give advice to sub-contractors and team members such as Engineer, Technician, and   workers.• Develop and manage new method and strategy for improving and speeding up the project.• Develop and manage cost data on all types of buildings and infrastructure works.• Coordinate with sub-contractors regarding any issue or any problem that may occur.• Prepare cost plans and cost analyses, co-operate with designers to ensure that building   can be erected with an approved budget.• Other tasks as assigned by Management.

Job Description: Job Purpose: Digital has been the key area for preparing the business to be future readiness. This crucial role is created to mainly focus on prepare agency distribution for future business operations align with the directions from PCA. The functions will work to adapt, initiate, design, and implement all the digital learning platforms by the PCA to help PCLA reaches its business expectations.Main Duties:Digital Learning Development• Develop Agency annual Digital Learning Plans for agents and agency leaders.• Adjust the  digital learning contents from regional to fit with local business practice.• Build Local Digital Learning contents using best practices from agency force to improve agency performance.• Manage all PCLA Digital learning Platforms administration.• Participate in all Digital learning developments and enhancement to ensure the production is beneficial for agency force. Digital Learning Projects Implementation• Plan for all digital learning and development platform success launching.• Conduct Training on how to use digital learning platform and keep follow up for the effectiveness of the projects.• Engage with agency to make them familiar and use created digital learning platforms regularly.• Demonstrate digital learning projects and provide feedback for regional.• Coordinate closely with related parties such as agency management team, training, agency leader, etc. to communicate, reinforce the implementation of all the digital learning platforms.• Conduct Post project implementation analysis to ensure smoothness of platform. • Keep working with regional team to update and enhance the digital platform.Digital Learning communication• Work closely with selected representatives from each agency team to keep them align and clear on the purpose and direction of digital learning• Build digital learning awareness for sale leaders, Agency and help them to be ready for future readiness.• Create ongoing campaign to promote Agency digital platform to potential user.• Promote and recognize agency who perform well in digital learning platform.• Keep track on the improvement of agency force on digital learning and keep communicate this with agency force.
Job Requirement: Required:- Bachelor's degree, preferably in Education/Training, Digital Marketing, Business Administration, Economics.- At least 3-year experience in teaching, or training.Desirable:- At least 2-year experience in insurance sales, marketing, business and training.- Good understanding of the industry and Cambodia business environment.- Fluent in English writing and speaking.- Excellent presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills.

job title: គ្រូបឋមសិក្សាចំណេះទូទៅខេមរភាសា(ច្រើននាក់)
position: គ្រូបឋមសិក្សាចំណេះទូទៅខេមរភាសា(ច្រើននាក់)
Job Description:
•	បង្រៀនសិស្សបឋមសិក្សាចំណេះទូទៅខេមរភាសា និងធានាឲ្យបាននូវគុណភាពនៃការអប់រំ ទាំងចំណេះដឹង បំណិន និងអភិវឌ្ឍបុគ្គលិកលក្ខណៈ
•	បំពេញកិច្ចការដ្ឋបាលសាលា និងរដ្ឋបាលថ្នាក់រៀន
•	ពង្រឹងវិន័យសិស្សឲ្យបានខ្ជាប់ខ្ជួន។
•	ណែនាំ និងសម្របសម្រួលសកម្មភាពរបស់សិស្ស
•	ពិនិត្យតាមដាន និងធ្វើរង្វាយតម្លៃជាប្រចាំដល់សិស្ស
•	សាកសួរដល់ផ្ទះសិស្ស និងជំនួបរវាងមាតាបិតា ឬអ្នកអាណាព្យាបាលសិស្ស
•	ជួយសិស្សក្នុងការស្រាវជ្រាវឯកសារក្នុងបណ្ណាល័យ និងអភិវឌ្ឍបំណិនជីវិត
•	រក្សាឲ្យបាននូវបរិស្ថានថ្នាក់រៀនប្រកបដោយសុវត្ថិភាព និងមិនប៉ះពាល់ដល់សុខភាព
•	សម្ភារបរិក្ខារ និងសម្ភារឧបទេស ដែលបានបំពាក់ក្នុងថ្នាក់ ត្រូវធានាឲ្យបាននូវការថែរក្សា ប្រកបដោយការយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ និងត្រឹមត្រូវ
•	ប្រើប្រាស់ទីធ្លាលេងកម្សាន្ត ដែលជាផ្នែកមួយនៃសកម្មភាពសិក្សាក្រៅថ្នាក់ ដើម្បីធានាថាទីធ្លាលេងកម្សាន្តនោះប្រកបដោយសុវត្ថិភាព
•	បំពេញកិច្ចការផ្សេងៗចាត់តាំងដោយប្រធាន
Job Requirement:
•	និសិ្សត ឬមានសញ្ញាបត្រមធ្យមសិក្សាគរុកោសល្យផ្នែកបឋម
•	បទពិសោធន៍បង្រៀនចំណេះទូទៅខេមរភាសា កម្រិតបឋមសិក្សា

Job Description:
Job Purpose

To operate the brewing process/equipment during shifts to ensure that the production process is carried out according to the Heineken quality standards and procedures.


Job Description

1.Health and Safety
Drive a ‘Safety First’ Attitude on his/her own shift to support the Brewing Team target of Zero Accidents.
Maintain a safe, clean working environment by helping operators & audit in order to keep a routine good housekeeping program to ensure food safety, hygiene, and OSH requirements are met

2.Quality
Ensure production meets quality specification (analytical, micro and market presentation) to deliver Brewing internal and external customer satisfaction
3. Teamwork
4. Continuous Improvement
Actively participate his/her own Teams and using TPM Methodology to Deliver 'Zero losses, zero failure, zero defects, zero accidents' Performance, measured by high Quality Production through AM/5S activities and reduction of Minor Stops, Wastage and Breakdowns.
5. Meet Production Targets
Actively involve meeting changeover, start-up, shutdown and line efficiency targets by prioritising tasks and daily workloads to ensure shop floor standards are achieved.
Job Requirement:
Education and Work Experiences:
- Bachelor's degree in Food science or related fields 

Leadership expectations: 
- Ability to connect and build trust through authentically empathy and logic
- Ability to shape the future by thinking big and setting a clear strategy
- Ability to develop, grow and motivate our people
- Ability to set and deliver against ambitious targets by raising the bar and taking ownership for results
- Ability to lead by example, promoting and role modelling the Heineken Behaviors in everything we do

Technical Skills:
•Makes timely supply of all raw, auxiliary, and cleaning & disinfection material at the place of use.
•Monitoring quality of the product & process
•Quality Inspection of the raw materials
•Basic Mathematical calculations 

Language requirements:
- English: good in written and spoken
- Khmer: mother tongue
Company Profile:
The HEINEKEN Company, the world's most international brewer who was formerly known as Cambodia Brewery Limited (CBL). The company was established in Cambodia in 1994 as a joint-venture between Asia Pacific Brewery Limited and Progress Import-Export Company, before becoming 100% HEINEKEN in 2014. 

A career with HEINEKEN offers great challenges combined with exciting opportunities to own and grow your career in line with your aspirations.

HEINEKEN has over 85,000 internationally diverse, dynamic, committed and entrepreneurial employees working in over 70 countries on over 300 brands.

HEINEKEN Cambodia offers several exciting packages including:
- Company Transportation (30 mins from PP)
- Healthy Lunch @our Canteen
- 13th month salary
- Various performance bonuses 
- Insurance plans (Personal Accident & Group Hospital & Surgical)
- Company clinic (with Certified doctors and nurse)
- Training & development programs
- Oversea Training and international assignment opportunities
- Personal Development Plan and more.

Interested candidates shall submit their Application through our Online Application:
careers.theheinekencompany.com/Cambodia/

or send CV & Cover Letter to: hrrecruitments@heineken.com

Head Office: Tiger Beer Street, Robos Angkagne Village, Sangkat Prek Eng, Khan Chbar Ompov, Phnom Penh
Tel: 096 776 6988

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Job Description:
- Work within a small, autonomous, start-up like team to design and develop business capabilities as microservices. This entails software design, prototyping, algo development, autonomation and technical delivery.
- Specifically work with Java, Spring Boot, databases, cloud (AWS, Linux), and in general a large variety of technologies, techniques, patterns, as needed to deliver awesome business-automating technologies.
- Support our business by understanding their needs, innovate novel approaches and deliver technical solutions that continue to drive down costs and risks.
- Work in high-caliber environment to craft software-development approach that accelerates concept-to-market velocity with an ever-increasing level of quality-
- Support our products in production that is right. we own the technologies from conceptualization and depreciation. 
- Learn and grow with us. we do automation frameworks, stateful microservices, data analyze, predictive modeling... in short, whatever it takes to digitalize and optimize our business.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science and/or Management Information System or equivalent fields
- Proficiency in design patterns and paradigms
- Proficiency in Java, including concurrency, collections, web services and at least once framework (Preferably Spring)
- Experience in Linux and bash scripting 
- Experience in front-end development (i.e. JavaScript, HTMLS/CCS3)
- Understanding of networking (load balancers, reverse-proxies, cloud), Security(encryption, firewalls) or user-experience design

Company Profile: Founded in 1984, CHINT is a leading global provider of smart energy solutions. It is actively deploying “4+1” industrial sectors including smart electrics, green energy, industrial control and automation, smart home and incubator, forming an integrated whole industry chain of “power generation, storage, transmission, substation, distribution, sales and consumption”. Company Profile:
Established in 2021, Mango Finance PLC is a digital microfinance startup based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, capitalized by an investment from Vipar Auto FZCO, Dubai. With direct access to over 100,000 customers, we are capturing the opportunity to lend digitally and securely.

Mango Finance PLC intends to transform the microfinance landscape in Cambodia by leveraging the powers of technology and data. We believe in improving access to capital for the unbanked in Cambodia, with our proprietary credit scoring engine.

Mango Finance PLC is a licensed Microfinance Institution, regulated by the National Bank of Cambodia. Please visit www.mangofinance.net for more information.

job title: មន្រ្តីដោះស្រាយបំណុល (Loan Recovery Officer)
position: មន្រ្តីដោះស្រាយបំណុល (Loan Recovery Officer)
Job Description:
** តួនាទី និង ភារកិច្ចទទួលខុសត្រូវ

-សហការជាមួយមន្រ្តីឥណទាន រហូតដល់ប្រធានសាខាដើម្បី កំណត់និងវិភាគបញ្ហាឥណទានយឺតយ៉ាវ និងកំណត់ អាទិភាព និងយុទ្ធសាស្រ្តដើម្បីដោះស្រាយបំណុលដែលយឺតយ៉ាវប្រកបដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាព។ 
-ចុះធ្វើការសម្របសម្រួល និងប្រមូលឥណទានដែលយឺតយ៉ាវជា ប្រចាំតាមគោលការណ៍និតិវិធីរបស់ស្ថាប័ន។
-ចុះជួបជាមួយ អតិថិជនដែលយឺត ឬអ្នកធានា ដើម្បីចរចារទាម ទារសំណង ឬមានវិធានការផ្លូវច្បាប់ផ្សេងៗ ។
-រៀបចំរបាយការណ៍ពីស្ថានភាពប្រមូលប្រាក់ ប្រចាំថ្ងៃ សប្តាហ៍ ខែ ពីបម្រែបម្រួលរបស់អតិថិជននីមួយៗ។ 
-រៀបចំឯកសារផ្លូវច្បាប់ក្នុងករណីដែលត្រូវប្តឹងទាមទារសំណង។
-ការងារផ្សេងៗទៀតត្រូវបានចាត់ចែងដោយប្រធា
Job Requirement:
**លក្ខខណ្ឌនៃការជ្រើសរើស

-និស្សិតកំពង់សិក្សា បរិញ្ញបត្រពាណិជ្ជកម្មក្នុង ធនាគារនិងហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ គណនេយ្យសេដ្ឋកិច្ចពាណិជ្ជកម្ម ឬវិស័យផ្សេងៗ
-មានបទពិសោធការងារចាប់ពី០២ឆ្នាំឡើងទោក្នុងវិស័យហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ ឬធនាគាររឹតតែប្រសើរ
-មានចំណេះដឹងខាងផ្នែកធនាគារហិរញ្ញវត្ថុទីផ្សារ និង យល់ដឹងពីបញ្ហាមីក្រូហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ។
-ជនជាតិខ្មែរ មានអាយុចាប់ ១៨ឆ្នាំឡើងទៅ 
-មានលក្ខណៈសម្បត្តិសមរម្យ មានទំនាក់ទំនងល្អ និង ចេះគោរព គ្នាទៅវិញទៅមក ស្មោះត្រង់ និង ចេះអត់ធ្មត់ក្នុងការងារ។
-មានចំណេះដឹងកុំព្យូទ័រ (Word,Excel,Outlook) និង CBC 
-មានឆន្ទៈក្នុងការងារ គោរពវិន័យ និង ពេលវេលា 
-មានយាន្តជំនិះផ្ទាល់ខ្លួន (ម៉ូតូ) និង ជិះម៉ូតូឆ្ងាយបាន។

**អត្ថប្រយោជន៍ដែលទទួលបាន

-ប្រាក់ឈ្នួលសមរម្យ និង មានលក្ខណៈប្រគួតប្រជែង 
-ប្រាក់លើកទឹកចិត្តប្រចាំខែ
-ប្រាក់ឧបត្ថម្ភថ្លៃសាំង និង ថែទាំម៉ូតូ (90$-100$) អាស្រ័យ លើតំបន់ប្រតិបត្តការ 
-ប្រាក់បុព្វលាភសម្រាប់ចូលឆ្នាំខ្មែរ និង បុណ្យភ្ជុំបិណ្ឌ
-ឯកសណ្ឋាន និងសំភារៈធ្វើការងារ
-ការធានារ៉ាប់រងសុខភាព និង គ្រោះថ្នាក់ការងារ (បសស)
-ការបណ្តុះបណ្តាលពាក់ព័ន្ធនិងការងារនិងអាជីពការងារ អនាគត់
-ផ្តល់កន្លែងស្នាក់នៅ សម្រាប់បុគ្គលិកសាខា

Job Description:
-Establishes financial status by developing and implementing systems for collecting, analyzing, verifying, and reporting financial information, and managing accounting staff.
-Achieves accounting operational objectives by contributing accounting information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; and implementing change.
-Meets accounting financial objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions.
-Confirms financial status by monitoring revenue and expenses; coordinating the collection, consolidation, and evaluation of financial data; and preparing special reports.
-Maintains accounting controls by establishing a chart of accounts and defining accounting policies and procedures.
-Maintains financial security by establishing internal controls.
-Avoids legal challenges by understanding current and proposed legislation, enforcing accounting regulations, and recommending new procedures.
-Protects organization’s value by keeping information confidential.
-Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.
-Accomplishes accounting and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
Job Requirement:
-Degree holder in Accounting is a must
-Supervisory experience at least 4 years in accounting functions. 
Experience in Trading Business is preferable.
-Well experienced in dealing with taxation matters in Cambodia and good knowledge in tax rules and regulations
-Proven knowledge of managing internal control system
-Ambitious in developing the company as one’s self career growth; view oneself as a stakeholder in the company
-Good command of both written and spoken Khmer and English
-Possessing strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other office applications, and accounting software such as QuickBooks
-Strong time management and result-oriented. Proven record to work under pressure and tight timeline

 
* Other Information
-Monthly Salary: Negotiation
-Annual salary review and the 13th month salary
-Other benefit: Insurance, Mobile phone and others.

Job Description:
-Develop and update HR & Admin policies, internal rules and regulations, company policies, work procedures and guideline to ensure HR functions are effectively and efficiently managed.
-Ensure the recruitment and selection process (Posting job ads, short-listing, contacting candidates, Interviewing, checking references, selecting, negotiating the offers) meet company requirements.
-Prepare and deliver soft skill training courses to staff.
-Conduct exit/ termination interviews.
-Oversee functions of HR services within the company such as recruitment, hiring, employee record-keeping including contracts/ agreements, compensation, stationery, company fix assets and benefits for employees.
-Ensure the record and report of company fixed assets is properly conducted as required from time to time.
-Follow up and check all daily and monthly reports such as attendance, store Report and other tasks related to the HR & Admin department.
-Assist management in preparing annual estimates of expenditure, maintain budgetary and inventory controls and make recommendations.
-Develop and oversee implementation of staff policies.
-Conduct orientation programs for new employees and update from time to time the company profile and company events.
-Assist departmental heads in reviewing and updating the Job Description, Title, and/ or Responsibility changes within their departments.
-Assist to all departmental heads in coordinating probation evaluation and annual performance appraisal of all staffs.
-Act as bridge for different departments and staff and resolve any conflicts when it occurs.
-Coordinate applicant screening and interviewing activities with line managers and make the best possible hiring decision.
-Develop and maintain the staff benefits and motivation program.
-Provide administrative support to departments dealing with the task of editing, typing, mailing, filing and translation (both verbal and documentation).
-Must process good observation power and monitoring the work of the back office.
-Develop templates for the company.
-Liaise with any external parties such institutional and/ or government authorities should the need arise.
-Perform and document minutes meeting for department heads during internal meetings.
-Assist in managing general administrative tasks and lead the team.
-Submit monthly HR and Admin reports to reporting line manager.
-Perform other tasks assigned by the management.
Job Requirement:
-Female is highly motivated to apply.
-Preferably a Bachelor in Business Administration or equivalent.
-Minimum 3-4 year work experience in human resource and administrative field.
-Experience in Restaurant is plus. 
-Experience in private sector is highly desirable.
-Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word & PowerPoint.
-Good spoken and written English language skill is required.
-Good knowledge of local labor law and local HR practices.
-Highly experienced in employee relations, troubleshooting and problem solving.

* Other Information
-Monthly Salary: Negotiation
-Annual salary review and the 13th month salary
-Other benefit: Insurance, Mobile phone and others.

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.
